Ryanair Cancels Flights Amid French Air Traffic Control Strike
Ryanair Cancels Flights Amid French Air Traffic Control Strike
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
February 6, 2023 Monday 6:05 AM EST
Copyright 2023 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 57 words
Body
 Ryanair (RYA.IR) said it canceled a small number of flights due to the French air traffic control strike from Monday 
to Wednesday.
The budget airline called on the European Commission to intervene and prevent the cancellation of flights that fly 
over France, according to a Monday release.
Ryanair was down more than 1% in Monday morning trading.
Load-Date: February 6, 2023
End of Document
10 Best Things to do for Galentine's Day
10 Best Things to do for Galentine's Day
Newstex Blogs 
DESIblitz
February 6, 2023 Monday 5:11 PM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1402 words
Byline: Tiyanna Mistry
Body
Feb 06, 2023( DESIblitz: http://www.desiblitz.com Delivered by Newstex)  
 Galentine's Day is a new celebration that is growing in popularity, especially amongst millennials who are 
constantly on the lookout for ways to commemorate it. 
Whilst many individuals will be aware of Valentine's Day as February 14th, the day to celebrate love, they will not 
have heard of Galentine's Day which is celebrated the day prior. 
Galentine's Day is an unofficial holiday to celebrate female friendships and honour a different type of love that you 
may have in your life, like the one that exists between friends. 
Valentine's day doesn't have to just be about romantic love it can be a day to celebrate all forms of love and 
Galentine's Day aims to do just that whether it's between friends or family. 
DESIblitz has put together a list of 10 of the best ways you can celebrate Galentine's Day this February 13th. 
Bottomless Brunch 
Going out for bottomless brunch has rapidly grown in popularity whereby groups are able to go out for a meal and 
get an unlimited number of drinks for the duration of their meal at a selected price. 
The concept has been a hit, especially with larger groups of people who are looking for a fun way to celebrate 
occasions whilst eating and drinking. 
There are many chain restaurants across the UK that now offer a bottomless brunch service. 
One of the most popular spots is Turtle Bay. Related Reads 
The Caribbean restaurant has been a major go-to brunch place for many as it is priced affordably at 31.50pp and 
offers two hours of unlimited cocktails, mocktails, red stripe and prosecco. 
Other popular bottomless brunch spots across the UK include Slug and Lettuce, Banyan and Manahatta. 
So, be sure to check them out this Galentine's Day. 
Pamper Night 
What better way to celebrate the love and respect in female friendships than a pamper night filled with fun, 
relaxation, and self-care? 
Spend the evening pampering yourself and your friends with a spa-inspired day filled with facemasks, mani-pedis, 
and massages. 
If you're struggling with where to get pamper evening essentials for you and the girls then be sure to check out the 
pamper and spa boxes sold by Beauty in the Box[1], Cult Beauty[2] and Sanctuary Spa[3]. 
10 Best Things to do for Galentine's Day
A pamper night will definitely boost spirits and create an evening of relaxation for you and the girls. 
Girls Getaway 
Galentine's Day is a perfect excuse to plan a girl's trip either abroad or even a staycation in a different part of the 
country. 
There are so many airlines like RyanAir and EasyJet that offer affordable flights across the world, especially in 
February as it is not a peak travel time. 
If going abroad isn't practical, but you would still like a weekend away, try booking a staycation in the country. 
The UK boasts beautiful cities like Edinburgh and York that have gorgeous sights, restaurants, and activities. 
Websites such as Booking.com, Loveholidays, and Lastminute.com, all offer last-second escapes within the country 
and outside of it. 
So, get planning your girl's getaway this Galentine's Day. 
Afternoon Tea 
If a more sophisticated outing is on your mind this Galentine's Day then plan afternoon tea for you and the girls. 
There are plenty of cafes and restaurants that offer an amazing afternoon tea service in the UK. 
For example, there is Betty's Afternoon Tea[4] in various locations across Yorkshire, Fortnum & Mason in London, 
and Malmaison in Birmingham. 
You could also plan your own afternoon tea and set it up from the comfort of your own home complete with finger 
sandwiches, scones, teacakes, and of course a big Victoria sponge. 
Movie Night 
A relaxing movie marathon with your best pals couldn't be a better way to enjoy and celebrate love in friendships. 
Many Galentine's films celebrate female friendships that you could choose from. 
Pick from Girls Trip, Thelma and Louise, 50 first dates, and Breakfast at Tiffany's, to name but a few. 
Alternatively, you could blitz through a box set and spend the day enjoying your favourite binge-worthy shows and 
films like Harry Potter or Friends. 
So warm up the popcorn and get your favourite movie snacks to celebrate Galentine's Day. 
Order a Takeaway 
You can't go wrong with a takeaway and a good movie so why not order a big takeaway for you and the girls to 
share this Galentine's Day? 
The cuisine options are endless when it comes to takeaways, and you can choose from Indian, Chinese, Mexican, 
Italian, and much more. 
There are enough varieties of food to please everyone. 
With food delivery apps like Just Eat, Deliveroo and Uber Eats, ordering food for large groups has never been 
easier. 
A takeaway and a chilled evening with girls is the perfect option for those wanting a lowkey Galentine's on a budget. 
Exchange Gifts 
Most people buy gifts for their significant other on Valentine's Day, so why not buy a gift for your friends too? 
Exchanging gifts doesn't have to be limited to Christmas or for romantic couples on Valentine's. 
Gifts can also be exchanged between friends to honour platonic love as well. 
There are plenty of gifts you can get a friend this Galentine's including a spa treatment, flowers, chocolates or even 
a nice bottle of wine. 
If you're feeling extra lovey this Galentine's Day, why not get your best gal pals Galentine's Day cards too? 
You can customise your own special message to your girlfriends using Moonpig or Funky Pigeon to show your 
appreciation for them. 
Pottery Experience 
Engage in a fun and creative activity with friends like a pottery-making experience this Galentine's Day. 
Pottery is an artistic and stimulating outlet that has become extremely popular in recent years. 
New businesses have cropped up across the UK offering pottery-making sessions and classes for anyone and 
everyone. 
For example, places like the Clay Room in Leicester, The Sticky Earth Caf in Norfolk and Poppins Pottery in Devon 
are all businesses across the UK that offer package pottery experiences for groups of people. 
Or you can even buy a special someone a pottery experience voucher for Galentine's that they can use at a later 
date at BuyAGift[5]. 
Painting 
10 Best Things to do for Galentine's Day
If pottery isn't the creative outlet you were looking for this Galentine's Day then a painting class or experience might 
be. 
Comparable to pottery experiences, painting classes have been another activity soaring in popularity. 
The concept of sip and paint where individuals drink great wine, relax and paint has become the new way to spend 
time with friends. 
Companies like Sip N Stroke[6] and Class Bento have introduced sip and paint workshops and classes across 
different UK locations. 
So, be sure to check them out if you're looking for an activity-based Galentine's Day. 
Have a Party 
If its love and friendship that you're celebrating, then celebrate in style by throwing a Galentines-themed party with 
your closest friends 
Online companies like Amazon even have Galentine's Day-themed decorations and accessories that you could buy 
to amp up the party vibes including banners, party hats and balloons. 
You could even pick a dress code for the party, whether it's formal, causal or costumes that you want to rock. 
Throwing a party on Galentine's Day will for sure make the day a memorable occasion for everybody involved. 
From an unofficial holiday mentioned in the TV series, Parks and Recreation, to a worldwide celebrated occasion, 
Galentine's Day has become a holiday favourite for many. 
It is the perfect day to celebrate friendship and love regardless of relationship status as the day focuses on the 
platonic and everlasting love between friends. 
So be sure to check out these amazing ideas if you're struggling for ways to celebrate on Galentine's Day!

Huntington National Bank Grows Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
Huntington National Bank Grows Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
February 4, 2023 Saturday
Copyright 2023 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 837 words
Body
Ryanair Huntington National Bank boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get 
Rating ) by 26.1% during the 3rd quarter, HoldingsChannel.com  reports. The institutional investor  owned 2,041 
shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 423 shares during the quarter. Huntington 
National Bank's holdings in Ryanair were worth $119,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
Several other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA increased its stake in  Ryanair by 11.2% in the second quarter. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 10,007,784 shares of the transportation company's stock 
worth $673,025,000 after purchasing an additional 1,009,514 shares during the period.  Baillie Gifford & Co. 
increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 4.5% during the second quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 
9,685,552 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $651,353,000 after buying an additional 417,273 
shares during the period.  Lazard Asset Management LLC increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 4.4% during 
the second quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 6,042,557 shares of the transportation company's 
stock valued at $406,360,000 after buying an additional 254,644 shares during the period.  Wellington Management 
Group LLP increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 13.5% during the first quarter. Wellington Management 
Group LLP now owns 2,071,104 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $180,436,000 after buying 
an additional 246,276 shares during the period.  Finally, Royal Bank of Canada increased its stake in shares of  
Ryanair by 27.5% during the first quarter. Royal Bank of Canada now owns 2,038,087 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $177,557,000 after buying an additional 439,740 shares during the period. Hedge funds 
and other institutional investors own  42.82% of the company's stock.  Ryanair Trading Down 0.2 %
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $94.81 on Friday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $55.90 and a 
52-week high of $125.75. The stock has a market cap of $21.59 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 15.59 and a beta 
of 1.45. The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 0.92 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46. The 
business has a 50-day moving average price of $83.19 and a 200-day moving average price of $74.27.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 7th. 
The transportation company reported $5.32 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the consensus 
estimate of $5.43 by ($0.11). Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.13% and a net margin of 13.16%. The firm had 
revenue of $4.05 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $4.02 billion.  Equities analysts 
predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.88 EPS for the current year.  Analysts Set New Price Targets
Huntington National Bank Grows Stock Position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
Several equities analysts have recently commented on RYAAY shares. Raymond James raised their price target on 
Ryanair from $113.00 to $115.00 and gave the company a "strong-buy" rating in a research note on Wednesday. 
TheStreet downgraded Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c" rating in a research report on Monday. Liberum Capital 
downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Wednesday, October 12th. 
JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised their price objective on Ryanair from  18.20 ($19.78) to  21.00 ($22.83) and gave the 
company an "overweight" rating in a research report on Thursday, December 15th. Finally, StockNews.com  
downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Tuesday. One research analyst  
has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have assigned  a hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one  has 
issued  a strong buy rating to the company's stock. Based on data from MarketBeat, the company presently has a 
consensus rating of "Moderate Buy" and an average price target of $45.64. About Ryanair (Get Rating )
Ryanair Holdings Plc engages in the provision of low fares airline-related services. It provides various ancillary

(NASDAQ:RYAAY)

Zolmax.com

Body
Feb 04, 2023( Zolmax.com: http://www.zolmax.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Huntington National Bank increased its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get 
Rating[2]) by 26.1% in the third quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 
2,041 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 423 shares during the period. 
Huntington National Bank's holdings in Ryanair were worth $119,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other large investors have also added to or reduced their stakes in the stock. Rockefeller Capital 
Management L.P. boosted its position in shares of Ryanair by 34.2% in the third quarter. Rockefeller Capital 
Management L.P. now owns 691 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $39,000 after acquiring an 
additional 176 shares during the period. Parallel Advisors LLC purchased a new stake in Ryanair in the second 
quarter valued at approximately $64,000. Ronald Blue Trust Inc. purchased a new stake in Ryanair in the second 
quarter valued at approximately $90,000. Whittier Trust Co. of Nevada Inc. raised its stake in Ryanair by 656.4% in 
the third quarter. Whittier Trust Co. of Nevada Inc. now owns 1,770 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $103,000 after purchasing an additional 1,536 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Captrust Financial 
Advisors raised its stake in Ryanair by 25.9% in the second quarter. Captrust Financial Advisors now owns 1,963 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $132,000 after purchasing an additional 404 shares in the 
last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 42.82% of the company's stock. Wall Street Analyst 
Weigh In Several research firms have commented on RYAAY. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft lifted their price 
target on shares of Ryanair from €14.50 ($15.76) to €16.00 ($17.39) and gave the stock a "buy" rating in a research 
note on Tuesday, December 13th. Morgan Stanley began coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research note on 
Tuesday, January 10th. They set an "overweight" rating on the stock. Raymond James lifted their price target on 
shares of Ryanair from $113.00 to $115.00 and gave the stock a "strong-buy" rating in a research note on 
Wednesday. JPMorgan Chase & Co. lifted their price target on shares of Ryanair from €18.20 ($19.78) to €21.00 
($22.83) and gave the stock an "overweight" rating in a research note on Thursday, December 15th. Finally, 
TheStreet downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c" rating in a research note on Monday. One 
equities research analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have issued a hold rating, six have issued a buy 
rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the company. According to data from MarketBeat, the company 
presently has an average rating of "Moderate Buy" and a consensus target price of $45.64. Ryanair Stock 
Performance NASDAQ:RYAAY[3] opened at $94.81 on Friday. The stock has a market cap of $21.59 billion, a P/E 
Huntington National Bank Boosts Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
ratio of 15.59 and a beta of 1.45. The firm's fifty day simple moving average is $83.19 and its 200 day simple 
moving average is $74.27. Ryanair Holdings plc has a twelve month low of $55.90 and a twelve month high of 
$125.75. The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 0.92 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, November 
7th. The transportation company reported $5.32 earnings per share for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate 
of $5.43 by ($0.11). The company had revenue of $4.05 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus 
estimate of $4.02 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 13.16% and a return on equity of 21.13%. As a group, 
research analysts predict that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.88 EPS for the current year. About Ryanair (Get 
Rating[2]) Ryanair Holdings Plc engages in the provision of low fares airline-related services. It provides various 
ancillary services and engages in other activities connected with its core air passenger service, including non-flight 
scheduled services, Internet-related services, and the in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise.

Raymond James Raises Ryanair ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Price Target to $115.00
Raymond James Raises Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Price Target to $115.00
Newstex Blogs 
Zolmax.com
February 4, 2023 Saturday 11:12 AM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 915 words
Body
Feb 04, 2023( Zolmax.com: http://www.zolmax.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpg?v=20221104115452Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] 
- Get Rating[2]) had its price objective lifted by Raymond James from $113.00 to $115.00 in a research note issued 
to investors on Wednesday, Benzinga[3] reports. They currently have a strong-buy rating on the transportation 
company's stock. 
Other equities research analysts have also issued reports about the stock. Liberum Capital lowered shares of 
Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a report on Wednesday, October 12th. StockNews.com[2] lowered 
shares of Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a report on Tuesday. Morgan Stanley began coverage on 
shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, January 10th. They set an overweight rating for the company. TheStreet 
lowered shares of Ryanair from a b- rating to a c rating in a report on Monday. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. 
upped their price target on shares of Ryanair from €18.20 ($19.78) to €21.00 ($22.83) and gave the company an 
overweight rating in a report on Thursday, December 15th. One analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, two 
have given a hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one has given a strong buy rating to the stock. Based on 
data from MarketBeat.com, Ryanair has an average rating of Moderate Buy and an average price target of $45.64. 
Ryanair Trading Down 0.2 % Shares of Ryanair stock[4] opened at $94.81 on Wednesday. The firm has a market 
cap of $21.59 billion, a PE ratio of 15.59 and a beta of 1.45. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46, a 
current ratio of 0.92 and a quick ratio of 1.08. Ryanair has a 1 year low of $55.90 and a 1 year high of $125.75. The 
company has a 50 day simple moving average of $83.19 and a two-hundred day simple moving average of $74.27.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 
7th. The transportation company reported $5.32 earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus 
estimates of $5.43 by ($0.11). The business had revenue of $4.05 billion during the quarter, compared to the 
consensus estimate of $4.02 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.13% and a net margin of 13.16%. 
Analysts expect that Ryanair will post 5.88 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Institutional Trading of 
Ryanair A number of hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of the 
business. Simplicity Solutions LLC boosted its stake in Ryanair by 19.9% in the 4th quarter. Simplicity Solutions 
LLC now owns 5,686 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $425,000 after purchasing an additional 
943 shares in the last quarter. Raymond James Trust N.A. boosted its stake in Ryanair by 19.7% in the 4th quarter. 
Raymond James Trust N.A. now owns 4,185 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $313,000 after 
purchasing an additional 690 shares in the last quarter. Profund Advisors LLC boosted its stake in Ryanair by 9.1% 
in the 4th quarter. Profund Advisors LLC now owns 5,076 shares of the transportation company's stock worth

StockNews.com Lowers Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to Hold
StockNews.com Lowers Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to Hold
Newstex Blogs 
Watchlist News
February 3, 2023 Friday 10:30 AM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 822 words
Body
Feb 03, 2023( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpg?v=20221104115452StockNews.com[1] cut shares 
of Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[2] - Get Rating[1]) from a buy rating to a hold rating in a report published on Tuesday. 
A number of other equities analysts also recently commented on the company. TheStreet downgraded Ryanair from 
a b- rating to a c rating in a report on Monday. JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised their price objective on Ryanair from 
€18.20 ($19.78) to €21.00 ($22.83) and gave the stock an overweight rating in a report on Thursday, December 
15th. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft raised their price objective on Ryanair from €14.50 ($15.76) to €16.00 
($17.39) and gave the stock a buy rating in a report on Tuesday, December 13th. Liberum Capital downgraded 
Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a report on Wednesday, October 12th. Finally, Morgan Stanley started 
coverage on Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, January 10th. They issued an overweight rating on the stock. One 
research analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have assigned a hold rating, six have issued a buy rating 
and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the stock. Based on data from MarketBeat.com, the company currently 
has a consensus rating of Moderate Buy and an average price target of $45.64. 
Ryanair Stock Up 2.3 % 
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY[3] opened at $94.98 on Tuesday. The stock's 50-day moving average price is $82.81 
and its two-hundred day moving average price is $74.12. The company has a current ratio of 0.92, a quick ratio of 
1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46. Ryanair has a 12-month low of $55.90 and a 12-month high of $125.75. The 
firm has a market cap of $21.63 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 15.62 and a beta of 1.45.  
 Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[2] - Get Rating[1]) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, November 7th. 
The transportation company reported $5.32 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus 
estimates of $5.43 by ($0.11). Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.13% and a net margin of 13.16%. The business 
had revenue of $4.05 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $4.02 billion. On average, 
research analysts forecast that Ryanair will post 5.88 EPS for the current year. Institutional Investors Weigh In On 
Ryanair 
Several hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of the business. LPL 
Financial LLC increased its holdings in Ryanair by 2.5% during the 2nd quarter. LPL Financial LLC now owns 6,344 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $427,000 after purchasing an additional 153 shares during the 
last quarter. Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 34.2% in the 3rd 
quarter. Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. now owns 691 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$39,000 after acquiring an additional 176 shares in the last quarter. Truist Financial Corp grew its position in shares 
StockNews.com Lowers Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) to Hold
of Ryanair by 1.7% in the 3rd quarter. Truist Financial Corp now owns 11,458 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $669,000 after acquiring an additional 189 shares in the last quarter. SVB Wealth LLC grew

institutional investors.  
About Ryanair 
 (Get Rating[1]) 
Ryanair Holdings Plc engages in the provision of low fares airline-related services. It provides various ancillary 
services and engages in other activities connected with its core air passenger service, including non-flight 
scheduled services, Internet-related services, and the in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise.

Parents Leave Baby at Airport Check-In Counter To Catch Their Flight
Parents Leave Baby at Airport Check-In Counter To Catch Their Flight
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
February 03, 2023
Copyright 2023 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News - Airlines; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 464 words
Body
In what may have been an unprecedented turn of events, a couple abandoned their baby at an airport reception 
desk in Tel Aviv on Tuesday while they ran to catch their plane.
The passengers, who were not identified (but were evidently from Belgium), were running so late for their scheduled 
Ryanair flight from Ben-Gurion International Airport to Brussels that boarding had already closed by the time they 
arrived at check-in.
While they were already too tardy to check in for their flight, the pair caused a commotion after being told they 
needed to purchase a plane fare for the child and then ditched their infant at the desk.
According to Israel's N12 News, the parents decided to leave the infant in its carrier on the counter while they made 
a mad dash for security checkpoints and the terminal beyond in hopes of making it onboard.
As one might expect, they were not admitted onto the aircraft. Instead, they wound up being chased down by 
Airport Security officers after (presumably, panicked) check-in agents called for assistance.
"All the employees were shocked, we have never encountered anything like this. We couldn't believe what we were 
seeing," a Ryanair manager told local reporters.
The Israeli Airport Authority told the outlet, "The couple left the infant seat with the baby and ran toward the security 
checks at Terminal 1 in an attempt to reach the boarding gate for the flight."
The matter was then referred to local law enforcement, a Ryanair spokeswoman told CNN in an email. "These 
passengers traveling from Tel Aviv to Brussels (31 Jan) presented at check-in without a booking for their infant. 
They then proceeded to security leaving the infant behind at check-in," she explained. "The check-in agent at Ben 
Gurion Airport contacted Airport Security, who retrieved these passengers, and this is now a matter for local police."
N12 News reported that the couple was taken aside for questioning after being reunited with their offspring. But 
perhaps the incident was ultimately chalked up to absentmindedness on the parents' part, since a spokesman for 
Israel Police told CNN that the trouble seemed to have been settled by the time police officers got to the scene. 
"The baby was with the parents and there's no further investigation," he said.
Parents Leave Baby at Airport Check-In Counter To Catch Their Flight

Couple Abandon Baby When Airline Says Ticket Required
Couple Abandon Baby When Airline Says Ticket Required
Newstex Blogs 
iOTWreport
February 3, 2023 Friday 1:30 AM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 363 words
Byline: BFH
Body
Feb 03, 2023( iOTWreport: http://iotwreport.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Two Belgian Twatwaffles were told in an Israeli airport that their baby required a ticket to fly. The ticket counter was 
closed, so they left the baby in the stroller and took off for the plane. 
Newser-[1] 
Airport staff seea lot of[2]weird stuff[3]. But staff at Israel's main airport in Tel Aviv say 'we didn't believe what we 
were seeing' Tuesday as a couple—who'd purchased two tickets for a flight out of the country—ran off to catch their 
flight, leaving their infant son behind. Outlets suggest this wasn't an accident. The parents, who hold Belgian 
passports, had arrived late to the airport and only then learned they needed to buy a third seat for their child, 
reports theIndependent[4]. According to theTimes of Israel[5], they were unable to purchase a third ticket to 
Brussels as the check-in counter at Ben Gurion Airport had already closed. 
They 'then sprinted off toward security, leaving the infant behind in a baby carrier,' per theTimes. A short video 
shared by theNew York Post[6]shows someone pulling down a cover on the carrier to reveal the infant boy. A voice, 
speaking in Hebrew, reportedly says, 'She left him here, I swear!' 'All the workers were in shock,' said a Ryanair 
employee at the airport, per theTimes. 'We have never seen anything like that.' The couple was nabbed by airport 
security and didn't make their flight, perIsrael Today[7]. 
more[1]

on Wednesday, October 12th. Raymond James boosted their target price on Ryanair from $102.00 to $113.00 and

boosted their target price on Ryanair from €18.20 ($19.78) to €21.00 ($22.83) and gave the stock an overweight 
rating in a research report on Thursday, December 15th. One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell 
rating, two have given a hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the stock. 
Based on data from MarketBeat, the company presently has an average rating of Moderate Buy and a consensus 
target price of $45.64. Ryanair Stock Up 2.3 % RYAAY[3] opened at $94.98 on Tuesday. Ryanair has a one year 
low of $55.90 and a one year high of $125.75. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46, a quick ratio of 1.08 
and a current ratio of 0.92. The stock's fifty day moving average is $82.81 and its 200-day moving average is 
$74.12. The company has a market capitalization of $21.63 billion, a PE ratio of 15.62 and a beta of 1.45.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[2] - Get Rating[1]) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 7th. 
The transportation company reported $5.32 EPS for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $5.43 by 
($0.11). Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.13% and a net margin of 13.16%. The firm had revenue of $4.05 
billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $4.02 billion. On average, equities analysts 
predict that Ryanair will post 5.88 EPS for the current fiscal year. Institutional Inflows and Outflows Institutional 
investors and hedge funds have recently bought and sold shares of the company. Signaturefd LLC grew its stake in

Why Ryanair (RYAAY) is a Top Momentum Stock for the Long-Term
Why Ryanair (RYAAY) is a Top Momentum Stock for the Long-Term
Newstex Blogs 
Zacks Investment Research
February 3, 2023 Friday 3:50 PM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1123 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Feb 03, 2023( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 It doesn't matter your age or experience: taking full advantage of the stock market and investing with confidence 
are common goals for all investors. Luckily, Zacks Premium offers several different ways to do both. 
The research service features daily updates of the Zacks Rank and Zacks Industry Rank, full access to the Zacks 
#1 Rank List, Equity Research reports, and Premium stock screens, all of which will help you become a smarter, 
more confident investor. 
Zacks Premium includes access to the Zacks Style Scores as well. 
What are the Zacks Style Scores? 
The Zacks Style Scores, developed alongside the Zacks Rank, are complementary indicators that rate stocks 
based on three widely-followed investing methodologies; they also help investors pick stocks with the best chances 
of beating the market over the next 30 days. 
Each stock is given an alphabetic rating of A, B, C, D or F based on their value, growth, and momentum qualities. 
With this system, an A is better than a B, a B is better than a C, and so on, meaning the better the score, the better 
chance the stock will outperform. 
The Style Scores are broken down into four categories: 
Value Score 
For value investors, it's all about finding good stocks at good prices, and discovering which companies are trading 
under their true value before the broader market catches on. The Value Style Score utilizes ratios like P/E, PEG, 
Price/Sales, Price/Cash Flow, and a host of other multiples to help pick out the most attractive and discounted 
stocks. 
Growth Score 
Growth investors are more concerned with a stock's future prospects, and the overall financial health and strength 
of a company. Thus, the Growth Style Score analyzes characteristics like projected and historic earnings, sales, 
and cash flow to find stocks that will see sustainable growth over time. 
Momentum Score 
Momentum trading is all about taking advantage of upward or downward trends in a stock's price or earnings 
outlook, and these investors live by the saying "the trend is your friend." The Momentum Style Score can pinpoint 
Why Ryanair (RYAAY) is a Top Momentum Stock for the Long-Term
good times to build a position in a stock, using factors like one-week price change and the monthly percentage 
change in earnings estimates. 
VGM Score 
What if you like to use all three types of investing? The VGM Score is a combination of all Style Scores, making it 
one of the most comprehensive indicators to use with the Zacks Rank. It rates each stock on their combined 
weighted styles, which helps narrow down the companies with the most attractive value, best growth forecast, and 
most promising momentum. 
How Style Scores Work with the Zacks Rank 
The Zacks Rank, which is a proprietary stock-rating model, employs earnings estimate revisions, or changes to a 
company's earnings expectations, to make building a winning portfolio easier. 
It's highly successful, with #1 (Strong Buy) stocks producing an unmatched +25.41% average annual return since 
1988. That's more than double the S&P 500. But because of the large number of stocks we rate, there are over 200 
companies with a Strong Buy rank, plus another 600 with a #2 (Buy) rank, on any given day. 
With more than 800 top-rated stocks to choose from, it can certainly feel overwhelming to pick the ones that are 
right for you and your investing journey. 
That's where the Style Scores come in. 
You want to make sure you're buying stocks with the highest likelihood of success, and to do that, you'll need to 
pick stocks with a Zacks Rank #1 or #2 that also have Style Scores of A or B. If you like a stock that only as a #3 
(Hold) rank, it should also have Scores of A or B to guarantee as much upside potential as possible. 
Since the Scores were created to work together with the Zacks Rank, the direction of a stock's earnings estimate 
revisions should be a key factor when choosing which stocks to buy. 
For instance, a stock with a #4 (Sell) or #5 (Strong Sell) rating, even one that boasts Scores of A and B, still has a 
downward-trending earnings forecast, and a much greater likelihood its share price will decline as well. 
Thus, the more stocks you own with a #1 or #2 Rank and Scores of A or B, the better. 
Stock to Watch: Ryanair (RYAAY) 
Ryanair Holdings is the parent company of Ryanair Designated Activity Company (formerly known as Ryanair 
Limited). Ryanair, which commenced its flight operations in 1985, is based in headquartered in Swords, Ireland. 
RYAAY is a #1 (Strong Buy) on the Zacks Rank, with a VGM Score of B. 
Momentum investors should take note of this Transportation stock. RYAAY has a Momentum Style Score of B, and 
shares are up 12.5% over the past four weeks. 
Three analysts revised their earnings estimate higher in the last 60 days for fiscal 2023, while the Zacks Consensus 
Estimate has increased $0.59 to $5.88 per share. RYAAY also boasts an average earnings surprise of 7.5%. 
With a solid Zacks Rank and top-tier Momentum and VGM Style Scores, RYAAY should be on investors' short list.

Why Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Is Up 3.6% Since Q3 Earnings Release
Why Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Is Up 3.6% Since Q3 Earnings Release
Newstex Blogs 
Zacks Investment Research
February 3, 2023 Friday 7:30 PM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1007 words
Byline: Zacks Equity Research
Body
Feb 03, 2023( Zacks Investment Research: http://www.zacks.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Shares of Irish carrier Ryanair Holdings RYAAY[1] are performing well following the release of its third-quarter 
fiscal 2023 earnings report on Jan 30. Shares have gained 3.6% since then. The upside was due to the earnings 
beat reported by RYAAY. 
Lets delve deep into the earnings report and the guidance. 
Ryanair's third-quarter fiscal 2023 (ended Dec 31, 2022) earnings of 95 cents per share (excluding 4 cents from 
non-recurring items) beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 91 cents. Revenues of $2,630.9 million missed the 
Zacks Consensus Estimate of $2,606.2 million. Revenues surged 40.4% year over year, driven by upbeat 
passenger volumes. 
On the back of the buoyant traffic scenario in the Christmas/New Year period, RYAAY's profit after tax was €211 
million in third-quarter fiscal 2023 against a net loss of €96 million incurred a year ago. In the same time period, 
operating costs climbed 36% to €2.15 billion, driven by a 52% increase in fuel expenses to €0.90 billion. 
Average fares in the third quarter of fiscal 2023 were up 14% from the corresponding pre-COVID level. Net debt at 
RYAAY declined to €0.96 billion at the end of the fiscal third quarter from €1.45 billion at the end of the fourth 
quarter of fiscal 2022. 
Ryanair maintained its traffic forecast for fiscal 2023 of 168 million. Riding on a strong fiscal third quarter, profit after 
tax for fiscal 2023 is still expected to be in the €1.325 billion-€1.425 billion range. 
We remind investors that the current forecast was announced early last month owing to the surge in traffic 
witnessed during the peak Christmas/New Year period. The earlier guidance for profit after tax in fiscal 2023 was in 
the €1 billion-€1.20 billion band. 
Continuing the traffic strength in January, Ryanair flew 11.8 million passengers in the month, higher than the 7 
million flown a year-ago. Load factor (% of seats filled by passengers) in January 2023 was 91%, compared with 
79% a year-ago. Zacks Rank Ryanair currently sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). You can seethe complete list 
of today's Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.[2] 
Below we present some stocks from the Zacks Airline [3]industry, that have reported fourth-quarter 2022 earnings 
beat. 
Why Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Is Up 3.6% Since Q3 Earnings Release
Delta Air Lines' DAL[4] fourth-quarter 2022 earnings (excluding 19 cents from non-recurring items) of $1.48 per 
share beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.29 per share. DAL reported earnings of 22 cents per share a year 
ago, dull in comparison to the current scenario, as air-travel demand was not so buoyant then. 
Delta reported revenues of $13,435 million, which also surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $13,030.3 
million. Driven by the high air-travel demand, total revenues increased more than 41.87% on a year-over-year 
basis. Managementexpectsfirst-quarter 2023 earnings per share in the band of 15-40 cents. 
Alaska Air Group ALK[5] reported mixed fourth-quarter 2022 results, wherein earnings surpassed the Zacks 
Consensus Estimate but revenues missed the same. Quarterly earnings of 92 cents per share beat the Zacks 
Consensus Estimate of 90 cents. The bottom line surged more than 100% year over year. 
Reflecting the uptick in air-travel demand, consolidated traffic (measured in revenue passenger miles) rose 14% to 
12.85 billion. Consolidated load factor (percentage of seats filled by passengers) increased 6.1 percentage points to 
85.5% in the fourth quarter of 2022. Economic fuel price per gallon climbed 57.1% to $3.55.

Why the demise of Flybe is not a surprise
Why the demise of Flybe is not a surprise
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
February 02, 2023
Copyright 2023 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News - Airlines; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 529 words
Body
The outlook for aviation industry demand in 2023 is positive, but there may be increased consolidation, and failures 
of some weaker players. In particular, regional airlines may be at greater risk, and so it has turned out, with Flybe 
once again in administration.
It is worth remembering that Flybe was a struggling airline well before the pandemic, finding itself increasingly 
squeezed by low-cost airlines (and no thanks to a ridiculous double taxation on UK domestic flights, which has now 
been changed). In the run-up to the pandemic Flybe was trying, without success, to find a buyer.
The airline was eventually rescued in 2019 by a consortium including Virgin Atlantic, Stobart and Cyrus Capital. The 
timing was unfortunate, and Flybe was one of the first casualties of the Covid-19 pandemic, going into 
administration in March 2020 when lockdowns came into force in the UK and around the world.
The lowest cost wins
Cyrus Capital bought the business and assets, but in reality, the only real value was the 12 Heathrow slot pairs. 
Given that these slots were originally owned by British Airways but given up to Flybe as part of a remedy following 
the BMI takeover, the UK's Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) would not allow Cyrus Capital to have the slots without 
being a viable operation.
Cyrus found itself with no choice but to restart Flybe's operations, but in an even worse strategic position than 
before the pandemic. IBA's analysis shows that on the routes the airline operated, Flybe's share of seats was only 
10%, and it found itself competing with larger aircraft with a lower cost per seat. Lowest cost almost always wins on 
short-haul, and therefore it was inevitable that Flybe would struggle.
Will anyone buy Flybe?
In theory, Flybe's slots will revert to British Airways now, and with its aircraft fleet leased, it is questionable whether 
there is any value that can be salvaged from the airline. Yes, in theory an investor could buy the business and try 
again, but is anyone crazy enough to try this? Well, this is the airline industry, so we wouldn't totally rule it out. 
Though this is unlikely in our view, easyJet would love to take on British Airways at Heathrow, but 12 slot pairs are 
not enough to create a viable operation.
Why the demise of Flybe is not a surprise
More consolidation is to come
In summary, IBA believes that in 2023, the divide between the strong and the weak will get even wider. We saw 
Ryanair report record Q3 profits, and other Tier 1 players are guiding very positively. So, we continue to believe 
there will be an acceleration in consolidation in 2023, which is very positive for pricing from the airline's perspective 
- if not from the consumer's.
AirGuide and Pyramid Media connects you to an affluent, influential group of business and leisure travelers from 
across the globe with our Advertising Multimedia Network, Advertising eMail: advert@AirGuideOnline.com and 
Elevate your Customer Experience with our Tech and Content Solutions. For market intelligence and analysis see 
AirGuide 
Business 
News, 
and

Ryanair ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Cut to Hold at StockNews.com
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Cut to Hold at StockNews.com
American Banking and Market News
February 2, 2023 Thursday
Copyright 2023 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 672 words
Body
Ryanair Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) was downgraded by stock analysts at StockNews.com  from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a note issued to investors on Tuesday. 
Several other research firms also recently issued reports on RYAAY. Liberum Capital downgraded Ryanair from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Wednesday, October 12th. TheStreet downgraded Ryanair from a "b-" 
rating to a "c" rating in a report on Monday. Morgan Stanley initiated coverage on Ryanair in a research report on 
Tuesday, January 10th. They issued an "overweight" rating for the company. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft 
lifted their target price on Ryanair from  14.50 ($15.76) to  16.00 ($17.39) and gave the stock a "buy" rating in a 
research report on Tuesday, December 13th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. lifted their target price on Ryanair 
from  18.20 ($19.78) to  21.00 ($22.83) and gave the stock an "overweight" rating in a research report on Thursday, 
December 15th. One equities research analyst  has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have given a hold rating, 
six have given a buy rating and one  has given a strong buy rating to the company. According to data from 
MarketBeat, the company  has a consensus rating of "Moderate Buy" and a consensus price target of $45.64. 
Ryanair Stock Performance
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $92.86 on Tuesday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46, a 
quick ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio of 1.08. Ryanair has a one year low of $55.90 and a one year high of $125.75. 
The business's 50-day simple moving average is $82.47 and its 200 day simple moving average is $73.99. The 
company has a market cap of $21.15 billion, a P/E ratio of 15.33 and a beta of 1.44.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 7th. The 
transportation company reported $5.32 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of 
$5.43 by ($0.11). Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.00% and a net margin of 13.16%. The business had revenue 
of $4.05 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $4.02 billion.  On average, sell-side analysts 
forecast that  Ryanair will post 5.89 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  Institutional Inflows and Outflows
Institutional investors have recently added to or reduced their stakes in the stock. Allspring Global Investments 
Holdings LLC bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the fourth quarter worth $30,000.  Signaturefd LLC 
grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 399.0% in the third quarter. Signaturefd LLC now owns 514 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $30,000 after purchasing an additional 411 shares in the last quarter.  
Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. grew its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 34.2% in the third quarter. Rockefeller 
Capital Management L.P. now owns 691 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $39,000 after

Ryanair ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Price Target Raised to $115.00 at Raymond James
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Price Target Raised to $115.00 at Raymond 
James
American Banking and Market News
February 2, 2023 Thursday
Copyright 2023 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 674 words
Body
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) had its target price upped by Raymond James from $113.00 to $115.00 
in a research report sent to investors on Wednesday morning, Benzinga  reports. The brokerage currently has a 
strong-buy rating on the transportation company's stock. 
A number of other research firms have also recently commented on RYAAY. TheStreet cut Ryanair from a b- rating 
to a c rating in a research note on Monday. Morgan Stanley initiated coverage on Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, 
January 10th. They issued an overweight rating for the company. StockNews.com  lowered Ryanair from a buy 
rating to a hold rating in a report on Tuesday. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft boosted their price target on 
Ryanair from  14.50 ($15.76) to  16.00 ($17.39) and gave the company a buy rating in a report on Tuesday, 
December 13th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. boosted their price target on Ryanair from  18.20 ($19.78) to  
21.00 ($22.83) and gave the company an overweight rating in a report on Thursday, December 15th. One analyst  
has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have assigned  a hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one  has 
given a strong buy rating to the stock. Based on data from MarketBeat, the stock currently has an average rating of 
Moderate Buy and an average price target of $45.64. Ryanair Trading Up 2.6 %
RYAAY  opened at $92.86 on Wednesday. The stock has a market cap of $21.15 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 
15.27 and a beta of 1.45. The stock's 50 day moving average price is $82.47 and its 200-day moving average price 
is $73.99. Ryanair has a one year low of $55.90 and a one year high of $125.75. The company has a debt-to-equity 
ratio of 0.46, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio of 0.92.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last released its earnings results on Monday, November 7th. The 
transportation company reported $5.32 EPS for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $5.43 by 
($0.11). The business had revenue of $4.05 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $4.02 
billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 13.16% and a return on equity of 21.13%.  On average, equities analysts 
forecast that  Ryanair will post 5.86 EPS for the current year.  Institutional Trading of Ryanair

Investments Holdings LLC purchased a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the 4th quarter valued at $30,000.

Ryanair ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Rating Lowered to Hold at StockNews.com
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Rating Lowered to Hold at StockNews.com
American Banking and Market News
February 2, 2023 Thursday
Copyright 2023 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 671 words
Body
Ryanair Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) was downgraded by equities research analysts at 
StockNews.com  from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note issued to investors on Tuesday. 
Other equities research analysts have also recently issued reports about the stock. TheStreet cut shares of Ryanair 
from a "b-" rating to a "c" rating in a research report on Monday. Raymond James boosted their price target on 
shares of Ryanair from $102.00 to $113.00 and gave the company a "strong-buy" rating in a report on Monday, 
January 23rd. JPMorgan Chase & Co. boosted their price target on shares of Ryanair from  18.20 ($19.78) to  
21.00 ($22.83) and gave the company an "overweight" rating in a report on Thursday, December 15th. Morgan 
Stanley began coverage on shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, January 10th. They issued an "overweight" 
rating for the company. Finally, Liberum Capital lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a 
report on Wednesday, October 12th. One analyst  has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have given a hold 
rating, six have assigned  a buy rating and one  has given a strong buy rating to the company. Based on data from 
MarketBeat, the stock currently has an average rating of "Moderate Buy" and an average target price of $45.64. 
Ryanair Stock Performance
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $92.86 on Tuesday. Ryanair has a 52 week low of $55.90 and a 52 week 
high of $125.75. The stock has a market capitalization of $21.15 billion, a P/E ratio of 15.33 and a beta of 1.44. The 
firm has a fifty day simple moving average of $82.47 and a two-hundred day simple moving average of $73.99. The 
company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 1.08 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, November 7th. 
The transportation company reported $5.32 EPS for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $5.43 by 
($0.11). Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.00% and a net margin of 13.16%. The firm had revenue of $4.05 
billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $4.02 billion.  On average, analysts expect that  
Ryanair will post 5.89 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  Institutional Trading of Ryanair
A number of hedge funds have recently added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. Signaturefd LLC raised its 
position in  Ryanair by 399.0% during the third quarter. Signaturefd LLC now owns 514 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $30,000 after acquiring an additional 411 shares during the period.  Allspring Global 
Investments Holdings LLC acquired a new position in  Ryanair during the fourth quarter worth $30,000.  Rockefeller 
Capital Management L.P. raised its position in  Ryanair by 34.2% during the third quarter. Rockefeller Capital 
Management L.P. now owns 691 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $39,000 after acquiring an 
additional 176 shares during the period.  Parallel Advisors LLC acquired a new position in  Ryanair during the 
second quarter worth $64,000.  Finally, Ronald Blue Trust Inc. acquired a new position in  Ryanair during the 
Ryanair ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Rating Lowered to Hold at StockNews.com
second quarter worth $90,000. 42.82% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.

Ryanair and Wizz Air passengers surge in January, beat pre-pandemic
Ryanair and Wizz Air passengers surge in January, beat pre-pandemic
Alliance News UK
February 2, 2023 Thursday 10:47 AM GMT
Copyright 2023 Alliance News Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: Company Positive
Length: 284 words
Body
(Alliance News) - Budget airlines Ryanair Holdings PLC and Wizz Air Holdings PLC on Thursday reported a surge 
in passengers during January, beating pre-Covid restriction figures of January 2020.
Swords, Dublin-based Ryanair said it carried 11.8 million passengers in January 2023, up 69% from 7.0 million a 
year ago and 9.3% higher than 10.8 million in January 2020, which was the last January with no or minimal Covid 
restrictions. The load factor increased to 91% from 79% in January 2022, but was lower than 92% in January 2020. 
Budapest-based peer Wizz said it carried 4.1 million passengers in January 2023, up 73% year-on-year from 2.4 
million and beating January 2020's figure of 3.2 million passengers by 32%. Last month's load factor grew to 86% 
from 80% a year ago, but fell short of 90% it reported for January 2020.
January's capacity increased by 60% to 4.8 million seats from 3.0 million seats and beat January 2020's capacity of 
3.5 million by 38%.
On a rolling 12-months basis, Wizz Air's capacity climbed 76% to 54.5 million seats from GBP31.0 million seats at 
January 31, 2022. This beat January 2020's 43.1 million by 26%. Passenger figures more than doubled to 47.4 
million from 23.5 million a year ago and were 17% higher than 40.4 million in January 2020.
Wizz plans new flights to Istanbul, Antalya and Dalaman, connecting these three cities in Turkey with Hungary, 
Romania, the United Arab Emirates, and the UK, starting in March. 
Ryanair shares were up 2.7% to EUR15.33 each on Thursday morning, while Wizz shares were up 4.3% at 
2,767.00 pence.
By Tom Budszus, Alliance News reporter
Comments and questions to newsroom@alliancenews.com
Ryanair and Wizz Air passengers surge in January, beat pre-pandemic
Copyright 2023 Alliance News Ltd. All Rights Reserved.
Load-Date: February 2, 2023
End of Document

Ryanair's Passenger Traffic Soars 69% in January
Ryanair's Passenger Traffic Soars 69% in January
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
February 2, 2023 Thursday 3:18 AM EST
Copyright 2023 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 63 words
Body
 Ryanair (RYA.IR) said Thursday it flew 11.8 million passengers in January 2023, reflecting a 69% year-over-year 
increase.
The Irish low-cost carrier's load factor for the month climbed to 91% from 79% in the previous year.
The year-ago comparable period was hit by omicron-related travel restrictions in the EU, the filing noted. 
At close of Wednesday trading, the stock was up 1%.
Load-Date: February 2, 2023
End of Document
Italy's Bologna Airport Extends Partnership with Ryanair for Another Six Years
Italy's Bologna Airport Extends Partnership with Ryanair for Another Six 
Years
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
February 2, 2023 Thursday 4:42 AM EST
Copyright 2023 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 74 words
Body
 Italian airport operator Aeroporto Guglielmo Marconi di Bologna (ADB.MI) said Thursday it signed a six-year 
agreement to extend its ongoing partnership with Ryanair (RYA.IR).
The partnership, which pursues long-term sustainability objectives, started in 2008 and was strengthened in 2016. 
Both parties said the agreement includes the maintenance and development of the airline's network of connections. 
Both stocks were up some 2% in recent trade.
Load-Date: February 2, 2023
End of Document
Flybe : turbulence prompts a second nosedive
Flybe: turbulence prompts a second nosedive
Newstex Blogs 
The Week UK
February 2, 2023 Thursday 10:50 AM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 368 words
Byline: The Week Staff
Body
Feb 02, 2023( The Week UK: http://www.theweek.co.uk Delivered by Newstex)  
 The first reaction was shock, said Sophie Zeldin-O'Neill in The Guardian[1]. Some of those due to fly with Flybe, 
the UK regional airline that collapsed for the second time in three years last weekend, had booked tickets just hours 
before the news came through. 'I got an email asking me to check in, and ten minutes later they had gone into 
administration,' said one passenger. Hundreds of others were left 'stranded' and out-of-pocket at their outbound 
destination because the company wasn't part of the Atol protection scheme.  
Doubtless some 300 staff, now in limbo as administrators comb through the books, will sympathise with their plight, 
said Jon Yeomans in The Sunday Times[2]. Yet it turns out that the writing was already on the wall. The Belfast- 
and Birmingham-based carrier, which was losing 5m a month, had begun looking for a buyer in October - just six 
months after it relaunched. The owner, the US hedge fund Cyrus Capital, is now listed as a creditor, along with 
several leasing firms. Ryanair has reportedly offered a lifeline to Flybe staff by setting up a fast-track recruitment 
process. 
Flybe's latest nosedive is a blow to 'regional connectivity', and thus the Government's levelling-up agenda, said Ben 
Marlow in The Daily Telegraph[3]. But the troubles of smaller European carriers - Norway's Flyr is the latest to face 
'permanent grounding' - are a boon to larger competitors such as easyJet and Ryanair. Reduced competition is 
rarely good for any market. But in UK aviation, where ticket prices rose by an eye-popping 44.1% last year, the 
growing 'stranglehold' is particularly grim. For now, passengers seem willing to put up with it: Ryanair is on course 
for record profits this year. 'At some point, though, a backlash seems inevitable.' 
 [ 1]: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2023/jan/28/its-just-outrageous-flybe-passengers-on-the-frustration-of-
cancelled-flights [ 2]: https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/flybe-lost-5m-a-month-before-collapse-qcv6sq8b6 [ 3]: 
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2023/01/31/flybe-collapse-leaves-holidaymakers-mercy-ruthless-no-frills/ 
Link to the original story.
Notes

 Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) was downgraded by stock analysts at StockNews.com[2] from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a note issued to investors on Tuesday. 
Several other research firms also recently issued reports on RYAAY. Liberum Capital downgraded Ryanair from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Wednesday, October 12th. TheStreet downgraded Ryanair from a "b-" 
rating to a "c" rating in a report on Monday. Morgan Stanley initiated coverage on Ryanair in a research report on 
Tuesday, January 10th. They issued an "overweight" rating for the company. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft 
lifted their target price on Ryanair from €14.50 ($15.76) to €16.00 ($17.39) and gave the stock a "buy" rating in a 
research report on Tuesday, December 13th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. lifted their target price on Ryanair 
from €18.20 ($19.78) to €21.00 ($22.83) and gave the stock an "overweight" rating in a research report on 
Thursday, December 15th. One equities research analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have given a 
hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one has given a strong buy rating to the company. According to data 
from MarketBeat, the company has a consensus rating of "Moderate Buy" and a consensus price target of $45.64.

and a one year high of $125.75. The business's 50-day simple moving average is $82.47 and its 200 day simple 
moving average is $73.99. The company has a market cap of $21.15 billion, a P/E ratio of 15.33 and a beta of 1.44.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 7th. 
The transportation company reported $5.32 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the consensus 
estimate of $5.43 by ($0.11). Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.00% and a net margin of 13.16%. The business 
had revenue of $4.05 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $4.02 billion. On average, sell-
side analysts forecast that Ryanair will post 5.89 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Institutional Inflows

Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Price Target Raised to $115.00 at Raymond James
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Price Target Raised to $115.00 at Raymond 
James
Newstex Blogs 
Ticker Report
February 2, 2023 Thursday 11:07 AM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 853 words
Body
Feb 02, 2023( Ticker Report: http://www.tickerreport.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpg?v=20221104115452Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] 
- Get Rating[2]) had its target price upped by Raymond James from $113.00 to $115.00 in a research report sent to 
investors on Wednesday morning, Benzinga[3] reports. The brokerage currently has a strong-buy rating on the 
transportation company's stock. 
A number of other research firms have also recently commented on RYAAY. TheStreet cut Ryanair from a b- rating 
to a c rating in a research note on Monday. Morgan Stanley initiated coverage on Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, 
January 10th. They issued an overweight rating for the company. StockNews.com[2] lowered Ryanair from a buy 
rating to a hold rating in a report on Tuesday. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft boosted their price target on 
Ryanair from €14.50 ($15.76) to €16.00 ($17.39) and gave the company a buy rating in a report on Tuesday, 
December 13th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. boosted their price target on Ryanair from €18.20 ($19.78) to 
€21.00 ($22.83) and gave the company an overweight rating in a report on Thursday, December 15th. One analyst 
has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have assigned a hold rating, six have given a buy rating and one has 
given a strong buy rating to the stock. Based on data from MarketBeat, the stock currently has an average rating of 
Moderate Buy and an average price target of $45.64. Ryanair Trading Up 2.6 % RYAAY[4] opened at $92.86 on 
Wednesday. The stock has a market cap of $21.15 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 15.27 and a beta of 1.45. The 
stock's 50 day moving average price is $82.47 and its 200-day moving average price is $73.99. Ryanair has a one 
year low of $55.90 and a one year high of $125.75. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46, a quick ratio of 
1.08 and a current ratio of 0.92.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) last released its earnings results on Monday, November 7th. The 
transportation company reported $5.32 EPS for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $5.43 by 
($0.11). The business had revenue of $4.05 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $4.02 
billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 13.16% and a return on equity of 21.13%. On average, equities analysts 
forecast that Ryanair will post 5.86 EPS for the current year. Institutional Trading of Ryanair Hedge funds have 
recently bought and sold shares of the stock. Signaturefd LLC lifted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 399.0% 
during the 3rd quarter. Signaturefd LLC now owns 514 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$30,000 after purchasing an additional 411 shares during the last quarter. Allspring Global Investments Holdings 
LLC purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the 4th quarter valued at $30,000. Rockefeller Capital 
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Price Target Raised to $115.00 at Raymond James
Management L.P. lifted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 34.2% during the 3rd quarter. Rockefeller Capital 
Management L.P. now owns 691 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $39,000 after purchasing 
an additional 176 shares during the last quarter. Parallel Advisors LLC purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair 
during the 2nd quarter valued at $64,000. Finally, Ronald Blue Trust Inc. purchased a new stake in shares of 
Ryanair during the 2nd quarter valued at $90,000. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 42.82% of the 
company's stock. Ryanair Company Profile (Get Rating[2]) Ryanair Holdings Plc engages in the provision of low 
fares airline-related services. It provides various ancillary services and engages in other activities connected with its 
core air passenger service, including non-flight scheduled services, Internet-related services, and the in-flight sale

Fox Run Management L.L.C. Sells 1,689 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
Fox Run Management L.L.C. Sells 1,689 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
Newstex Blogs 
Watchlist News
February 1, 2023 Wednesday 3:31 PM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 916 words
Body
Feb 01, 2023( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Fox Run Management L.L.C. cut its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] – Get Rating[2]) 
by 27.2% during the 3rd quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission. The institutional investor owned 4,520 shares of the transportation company’s stock after 
selling 1,689 shares during the period. Fox Run Management L.L.C.’s holdings in Ryanair were worth $264,000 as 
of its most recent SEC filing.  
Other large investors have also bought and sold shares of the company. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA 
raised its stake in shares of Ryanair by 11.2% during the 2nd quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA 
now owns 10,007,784 shares of the transportation company’s stock worth $673,025,000 after purchasing an 
additional 1,009,514 shares during the period. Lazard Asset Management LLC raised its stake in shares of Ryanair 
by 11.8% during the 1st quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 5,787,913 shares of the transportation 
company’s stock worth $504,242,000 after purchasing an additional 612,114 shares during the period. Royal Bank 
of Canada raised its stake in shares of Ryanair by 27.5% during the 1st quarter. Royal Bank of Canada now owns 
2,038,087 shares of the transportation company’s stock worth $177,557,000 after purchasing an additional 439,740 
shares during the period. Baillie Gifford & Co. raised its stake in shares of Ryanair by 4.5% during the 2nd quarter. 
Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 9,685,552 shares of the transportation company’s stock worth $651,353,000 after 
purchasing an additional 417,273 shares during the period. Finally, Wellington Management Group LLP raised its 
stake in shares of Ryanair by 13.5% during the 1st quarter. Wellington Management Group LLP now owns 
2,071,104 shares of the transportation company’s stock worth $180,436,000 after purchasing an additional 246,276 
shares during the period. 42.82% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors.  
Wall Street Analyst Weigh In 
A number of equities research analysts have recently commented on the company. TheStreet cut Ryanair from a 
“b-” rating to a “c” rating in a research note on Monday. Liberum Capital cut Ryanair from a “buy” rating to a “hold” 
rating in a research note on Wednesday, October 12th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. boosted their price objective on 
Ryanair from €18.20 ($19.78) to €21.00 ($22.83) and gave the company an “overweight” rating in a research note 
on Thursday, December 15th. Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft boosted their price objective on Ryanair from 
€14.50 ($15.76) to €16.00 ($17.39) and gave the company a “buy” rating in a research note on Tuesday, December 
13th. Finally, StockNews.com[2] cut Ryanair from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating in a research note on Tuesday. 
Fox Run Management L.L.C. Sells 1,689 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, two have issued a hold rating, six have assigned a 
buy rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the stock. Based on data from MarketBeat.com, Ryanair 
presently has an average rating of “Moderate Buy” and an average target price of $45.36. 
Ryanair Stock Down 1.3 % 
 RYAAY stock[3] opened at $90.53 on Wednesday. The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 1.08 
and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.46. The firm has a market capitalization of $20.62 billion, a PE ratio of 14.89 and a 
beta of 1.44. Ryanair Holdings plc has a twelve month low of $55.90 and a twelve month high of $125.75. The stock 
has a 50-day simple moving average of $82.47 and a two-hundred day simple moving average of $73.99.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] – Get Rating[2]) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Monday, November 7th. 
The transportation company reported $5.32 EPS for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of $5.43 by 
($0.11). Ryanair had a return on equity of 21.00% and a net margin of 13.16%. The business had revenue of $4.05 
billion for the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $4.02 billion. On average, equities analysts predict that 
Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.89 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair 
 (Get Rating[2]) 
Ryanair Holdings Plc engages in the provision of low fares airline-related services. It provides various ancillary 
services and engages in other activities connected with its core air passenger service, including non-flight 
scheduled services, Internet-related services, and the in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise.

and insider trades for Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] – Get Rating[2]).

UK's Loganair moves to assume vacated flybe. Routes
UK's Loganair moves to assume vacated flybe. Routes
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
February 01, 2023
Copyright 2023 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News - Airlines; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 255 words
Body
Loganair (LM, Glasgow International) has announced it will relaunch its Manchester International-Newquay route on 
February 10, 2023, as it moves to mop up marketshare left by the collapse of flybe..
The carrier's internet booking engine shows flights will operate daily.
The Manchester-Newquay route was one of just five services where flybe. was the only carrier. The collapsed 
regional carrier was the main operator at the Cornish airport with a 42.4% market share by scheduled weekly 
departure capacity ahead of its cessation of operations. In turn, the service from Manchester will be Loganair's only 
current route to Newquay. During the summer season, the airline also serves the Cornish seaside resort from 
Edinburgh and Newcastle, GB, the ch-aviation schedules module shows.
Other carriers, including Ryanair and easyJet, offered "rescue fares" to passengers holding tickets for cancelled 
flybe. flights, but have so far refrained from adding any new routes.
flybe. ceased all operations on January 28, 2023.

UK's Loganair moves to assume vacated flybe. Routes
UK's Loganair moves to assume vacated flybe. Routes
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
February 01, 2023
Copyright 2023 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News - Airports; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 255 words
Body
Loganair (LM, Glasgow International) has announced it will relaunch its Manchester International-Newquay route on 
February 10, 2023, as it moves to mop up marketshare left by the collapse of flybe..
The carrier's internet booking engine shows flights will operate daily.
The Manchester-Newquay route was one of just five services where flybe. was the only carrier. The collapsed 
regional carrier was the main operator at the Cornish airport with a 42.4% market share by scheduled weekly 
departure capacity ahead of its cessation of operations. In turn, the service from Manchester will be Loganair's only 
current route to Newquay. During the summer season, the airline also serves the Cornish seaside resort from 
Edinburgh and Newcastle, GB, the ch-aviation schedules module shows.
Other carriers, including Ryanair and easyJet, offered "rescue fares" to passengers holding tickets for cancelled 
flybe. flights, but have so far refrained from adding any new routes.
flybe. ceased all operations on January 28, 2023.

(NASDAQ:RYAAY)

February 1, 2023 Wednesday

Body
Ryanair Profund Advisors LLC reduced its stake in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) by 
10.2% during the third quarter, HoldingsChannel.com  reports. The firm owned 4,652 shares of the transportation

shares during the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own  42.82% of the company's stock.

Parents Refuse To Buy Baby Plane Ticket, Leave Him Behind At Airport Check -In
Parents Refuse To Buy Baby Plane Ticket, Leave Him Behind At Airport 
Check-In
Newstex Blogs 
International Business Times News
February 1, 2023 Wednesday 10:26 AM EST
Copyright 2023 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 434 words
Byline: Binitha Jacob
Body
Feb 01, 2023( International Business Times News: https://www.ibtimes.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 A couple traveling with a ticketless child from Israel to Belgium left the baby behind at the airport's check-in counter 
before hurrying off to try and catch their flight. 
Staffers at the airport noticed the baby in the carrier and stopped the couple, who were later taken in for questioning 
by the police. 
The baby's parents are Belgian passport holders and were traveling from Tel Aviv to Brussels when the incident 
took place, the Israel Airports Authority said Tuesday. The couple had arrived late for their Ryanair flight and found 
that the check-in counters were already closed, according to the Times of Israel[1]. 
In addition to not having a ticket for their baby, the couple refused to pay for another ticket and eventually left the 
little boy in his carrier at the check-in counter. They rushed towards the security check but were eventually 
intercepted by the airport staff. 
The workers told the parents to collect their baby and also informed airport security and the police about the 
incident. Cops reportedly took the parents in for questioning, and it is unclear if they managed to catch their flight to 
Brussels. 
The airlines released a statement and said it was the first time they dealt with such an experience. 
"All the workers were in shock. We have never seen anything like that. We didn't believe what we were seeing," the 
statement said. 
The Israel Airports Authority later said the couple, on finding the check-in counters closed when they arrived at 
Terminal 1, left the baby on the conveyor belt so they could go and deal with security, the Jerusalem Post[2] 
reported. 
In an unrelated incident[3] reported in 2019, a woman traveling on a flight from Saudi Arabia to Kuala Lumpur in 
Malaysia had left behind her baby at the airport. After realizing her baby was not with her, the woman refused to 
continue on the journey and asked the pilot to turn the mid-air flight around. The conversation between the air traffic 
controllers and the pilot was shared in a video, where the pilot was heard saying a passenger had left her baby in 
the waiting area. The flight eventually returned to King Abdul Aziz International Airport. 
Parents Refuse To Buy Baby Plane Ticket, Leave Him Behind At Airport Check -In
 [ 1]: https://www.timesofisrael.com/parents-leave-ticketless-baby-at-airport-check-in-as-they-rush-to-board-flight/ [ 
2]: https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/article-730165 [ 3]: https://www.ibtimes.com/woman-forgets-her-baby-airport-
terminal-refuses-continue-flight-2773943?utm_source=newstex&utm_medium=Feed&utm_campaign=_content 
Link to the original story.

Boeing gains 40 787, Max orders
Boeing gains 40 787, Max orders
AirFinance Journal
February 2023
Copyright 2023 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 329 words
Byline: Dominic Lalk
Body
Boeing logged orders for 40 new commercial aircraft in January - seven widebody 787-10s and 33 737 Max units.
Twenty-five of the Max aircraft were contracted by an undisclosed customer, while Japan's Skymark Airlines and 
Germany's Tui Group added orders for four Max aircraft each last month.
The seven 787-10 orders are listed as an undisclosed customer order for the time being.
Separately, market sources tell Airfinance Journal that Qatar Airways will begin taking delivery of 737 Max aircraft 
this year.
The airline had agreed to take 25 737 Max 10s but as type certification is proving more challenging than expected 
Qatar has now agreed to take Max 8s instead, the sources say. This was mostly a result of Qatar needing 
additional narrowbody capacity quickly, they note, adding that Boeing can supply Max 8s relatively quickly owing to 
cancelled orders, Russian sanctions, and Chinese backlog.
Qatar Airways operates more than 120 Boeing aircraft including 777 and 787 passenger jets along with 747 and 
777 freighters.
Deliveries
Boeing delivered 38 aircraft to customers in January, down from 69 aircraft handed over in December.
The January deliveries included 35 737 Max units and three 787s.
Southwest Airlines took the most Max aircraft, accounting for 12 units. This was followed by Ryanair (five), ALC 
(four), United Airlines (four), Westjet (two), Flydubai (two) and Avolon (two), as well as Aercap, Copa Airlines, 
Pembroke and Tui (one each).
Air France-KLM accepted a 787-10 from Boeing in January; Lufthansa and Qatar Airways accepted a 787-9 each.
Unnamed customers cancelled orders in January for 39 737 Max aircraft, leaving Boeing's net new orders for the 
period at 16. Boeing landed 203 net new orders in December 2022 and 55 in January 2022.
Boeing gains 40 787, Max orders
This February, Boeing gained an order from Air India for up to 290 aircraft. Firm commitments include 190 737 Max 
variants, 10 777Xs and 20 787-9s. Options are in place for 50 additional Max aircraft and 20 additional 787-9s.
Load-Date: March 6, 2023
End of Document
