Ireland 's Ryanair Reports 38% Growth in October Traffic
Ireland's Ryanair Reports 38% Growth in October Traffic
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
November 2, 2022 Wednesday 3:43 AM EST
Copyright 2022 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 60 words
Body
 Ryanair Holdings (RYA.IR) catered to 15.7 million guests in October, 38% higher than the figure in the prior-year 
period, according to a Wednesday news release.
The Irish low-cost carrier's load factor for the month rose to 94% from 84%.
In the first 10 months of 2022, traffic surged 178% to 157.4 million guests and load factor grew 12 percentage 
points to 91%.
Load-Date: November 2, 2022
End of Document
Ryanair flies more passengers in October than before pandemic
Ryanair flies more passengers in October than before pandemic
Alliance News UK
November 2, 2022 Wednesday 11:41 AM GMT
Copyright 2022 Alliance News Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: Company Positive
Length: 138 words
Body
(Alliance News) - Ryanair Holdings PLC on Wednesday said it carried more passengers in October than in pre-
pandemic October 2019.
The Dublin-based budget airline posted a 38% rise in passengers to 15.7 million last month from 11.4 million in 
October last year. Compared to pre-pandemic October 2019, passenger numbers rose 14% from 13.8 million. 
Load factor in October improved to 94% from 84% a year before.
On a rolling 12-month basis, passenger numbers nearly tripled to 157.4 million from a year ago and load factor was 
12% higher. Compared to October 2019, rolling annual passenger numbers rose 4.2% from 151.0 million.  
Ryanair shares were down 1.6% to EUR12.11 on Wednesday afternoon on the Deutsche Borse Xetra exchange. 
By Tom Budszus; tombudszus@alliancenews.com
Copyright 2022 Alliance News Limited. All Rights Reserved.  
Load-Date: November 2, 2022
End of Document

Assetmark Inc. Acquires 1,593 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ : RYAAY )
Assetmark Inc. Acquires 1,593 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
November 1, 2022 Tuesday
Copyright 2022 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 766 words
Body
Ryanair Assetmark Inc. increased its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) by 26.5% 
during the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 7,599 shares of 
the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 1,593 shares during the period. Assetmark Inc.'s 
holdings in Ryanair were worth $511,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.

increased its position in  Ryanair by 18.0% in the first quarter. Capital International Investors now owns 11,270,188

ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, duty-

Ryanair targets zero net debt by end of fiscal 2024
Ryanair targets zero net debt by end of fiscal 2024
AirFinance Journal
November 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 363 words
Byline: Hugh Davies
Body
Ryanair will continue to focus on reducing its net debt and retiring (EURO)1.6 billion ($1.6 billion) of bonds maturing 
next year while it envisages "peak" capital expenditure over the next two years.
During an investor presentation, Ryanair chief financial officer Neil Sorahan said the carrier had made a "significant 
reduction" in net debt despite (EURO)900 million of Capex during the six months ended 30 September. Net debt 
was (EURO)546 million at the end of September versus (EURO)1.5 billion at 31 March.
"We aim to have a broadly zero net debt position by the end of fiscal year 2024," Sorahan added. "We own our 
737s and over 90% are unencumbered which gives us a huge advantage over our competitors in a rising interest 
and lease rate factor environment."
"We're generating very strong cash flows and the fact that we're able to pay down debt is a testament to our 
balance sheet and our ability to recover from seismic shocks like the Covid-19 pandemic," Ryanair Group chief 
executive officer Michael O'Leary added.
"That's very important at a time when interest rates are rising. Ryanair's balance sheet is insulated from rising 
interest rates which will inflate the lease rates and borrowing rates of our competitors and widen the cost advantage 
we have over every other airline in Europe."
O'Leary ruled out paying a shareholder dividend for "at least" the next 12 months while it pays down debt.
Ryanair held total liquidity of (EURO)4.6 billion as of 30 September which will be used to repay (EURO)1.6 billion of 
bonds maturing between March and August 2023 as well as to fund aircraft deliveries over the coming years. The 
carrier estimates around (EURO)2.3 billion capital expenditure for fiscal year 2023 and up to (EURO)2.2 billion for 
2024.
"Some of that could move if Boeing are delayed but the next two years are our peak Capex years," said O'Leary.
Sorahan said that the company will be "opportunistic" around funding aircraft deliveries.
"Thanks to the strong balance sheet we can access the bond market, our banks are usually underrepresented both 
secured and unsecured.
Ryanair targets zero net debt by end of fiscal 2024
"Leasing companies have very little exposure to Ryanair; we'd love to get more," he continued.
Load-Date: November 28, 2022
End of Document
Ryanair to invest in Citi 's sustainable deposit initiative
Ryanair to invest in Citi's sustainable deposit initiative
AirFinance Journal
November 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 339 words
Byline: Hugh Davies
Body
Ryanair has signed on with Citi to become the first European airline to deposit funds in the bank's new sustainable 
deposit solution, launched earlier this year.
The agreement will allow the carrier to invest excess cash to support different sustainable financing projects across 
Citi's portfolio, such as renewable energy, water conservation, healthcare and education in emerging markets.
Funds invested are allocated to finance or refinance assets in a portfolio of eligible green and social finance 
projects, based on the criteria set out in the Citi green bond framework, social finance framework and social bond 
for affordable housing framework, and support Ryanair's sustainability agenda.
"Ryanair is proud to be leading sustainable aviation in Europe, which is further evidenced by our partnership with 
Citi to deposit funds in their new Sustainable Deposit Solution," commented Thomas Fowler, Ryanair director of 
sustainability.
"This will not only help us manage our finances more sustainably but will further drive our sustainability agenda in 
whole as we support several sustainability projects across Citi's portfolio, from water conservation to affordable 
housing and beyond."
"Citi is helping our clients to progress their own ESG priorities by providing the opportunity to support eligible 
environmental and social projects in Citi's portfolios," said David Tsui, Citi's global sustainability head of deposit and 
investment products.
"We are delighted to partner with Ryanair as the first European airline to deposit funds in our recently launched 
Sustainable Deposit Solution. We have committed to financing and facilitating $1 trillion in sustainable finance by 
2030 as part of goal to further the acceleration to a sustainable, low carbon economy," Tsui added.
Citi's new deposit solution, first launched in Asia Pacific in August, follows a number of sustainable finance products 
introduced by Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions in the region last year, including sustainable supply chain financing 
and sustainable trade loans.
Load-Date: December 5, 2022
Ryanair to invest in Citi 's sustainable deposit initiative

Ryanair profit soars to â,¬1.4bn
Ryanair profit soars to â,¬1.4bn
AirFinance Journal
November 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 438 words
Byline: Hugh Davies
Body
Ryanair Group's operating profit pre-exceptional items surged to (EURO)1.4 billion ($1.4 billion) for the three 
months ended 30 September, from a (EURO)254 million operating profit in the same period of 2021 due to the 
strong recovery in traffic over the summer period.
Revenue increased 125% year on year to (EURO)4 billion in the July-September quarter while operating costs 
increased 70% to (EURO)2.6 billion.
The European low-cost airline group recorded an exceptional unrealised mark-to-market post-tax loss of 
(EURO)125 million on the company's jet fuel call options as of 30 September. Fuel costs more than doubled to 
(EURO)1.1 billion during the third quarter due to increased production and higher fuel costs.
The carrier said it is raising its fiscal-year 2023 traffic guidance to 168 million passengers, versus 166.5 million 
carried pre-Covid-19.
"If we are fortunate to avoid such negative events like Covid and Ukraine in H2 then, thanks to our very strong 
traffic recovery, our advantageous fuel and currency hedges and our widening cost and market share leadership 
over competitors, we are hopeful that we will minimise our winter losses which would enable us to deliver an FY23 
profit after tax pre-exceptionals in a range of (EURO)1 billion to (EURO)1.2 billion," Ryanair stated.
The carrier reported total liquidity of (EURO)4.6 billion, including (EURO)1.7 billion of cash and cash equivalents, 
(EURO)2.8 billion of financial assets convertible to cash after three months, as well as (EURO)23 million of 
restricted cash.
Net debt was reduced to (EURO)546 million at the end of September versus (EURO)1.5 billion at 31 March, despite 
(EURO)900 million of capital expenditure in the first six months of fiscal-year 2023.
Gross debt increased by (EURO)60 million to (EURO)5 billion, primarily due to the extension of operating lease 
terms on 24 Airbus A320 aircraft until 2028 at lower rentals, offset by debt repayments during the period.
Net finance expenses decreased 19% to (EURO)36 million due to lower net debt, at mainly fixed interest rates, 
offset by higher cash balances and rising deposit interest rates.
Ryanair profit soars to â,¬1.4bn
"Almost all of the group's fleet of 737s are owned and over 90% are unencumbered which widens our cost 
advantage at a time when interest rates and leasing costs of our competitors are rising," Ryanair stated.
"Our focus over the next year is the repayment of (EURO)1.6 billion of maturing bonds while returning our balance 
sheet to a broadly zero net debt position."
Ryanair has taken delivery of 77 Boeing 737 Max aircraft as of 30 September with around 50 due for delivery ahead 
of the summer 2023 season.
Load-Date: November 28, 2022
End of Document
Boeing Max deliveries and sales rise in October
Boeing Max deliveries and sales rise in October
AirFinance Journal
November 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 264 words
Byline: Hugh Davies
Body
Boeing narrowbody delivery activity increased in October with 22 Boeing 737 Max units handed over to customers, 
up from 18 units in October last year, according to Boeing data.
Air Lease, BBAM and 777 Partners accounted for five 737 Max deliveries and two units went to business jet 
customers, with Alaska Airlines, Gol, Southwest Airlines, United Airlines, Copa Airlines, Ryanair and Lion Air 
making up the remainder.
Boeing 787 deliveries continued to ramp up with six units delivered, including one 787-10 each to Air France-KLM 
and All Nippon Airways, one 787-9 each to Lufthansa and Air Lease and one 787-8 to American Airlines.
Jefferies estimates that Boeing ended the third quarter of 2022 with roughly 115 787s in inventory, with production 
to increase to three per month on average during 2023, increasing to five at the end of 2023 and into 2024, with 
higher demand supporting production rate of six in 2025.
Year-to-date deliveries stand at 363 aircraft, including 299 737 Max units and 15 787s.
The manufacturer booked strong sales activity during October with 122 orders, mainly owing to large 737 Max 
orders placed by Alaska Airlines and International Airlines Group (IAG) for 52 and 50 737 Max aircraft, respectively.
Emirates placed an order for another five 777Fs while Fedex added one 767-300F to its orderbook.
Ten 787-9 aircraft orders were placed with an undisclosed customer.
Boeing has received 550 net orders in the first 10 months of the year, with 114 conversions/cancellations and none 
of these during October.
Its commercial backlog rose from 4,354 to 4,441 orders.
Load-Date: November 28, 2022
End of Document
Ryanair outlook turns positive
Ryanair outlook turns positive
AirFinance Journal
November 2022
Copyright 2022 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 441 words
Byline: Hugh Davies
Body
A strong recovery in air travel, accelerated deleveraging and a large unrestricted cash position has prompted Fitch 
Ratings to revise Ryanair Holding's outlook to positive from stable.
The agency has also affirmed the company's long-term issuer default rating (IDR) and Ryanair's senior unsecured 
rating at BBB.
Ryanair forecasts air traffic demand to last until the peak Christmas travel period, based on forward bookings. The 
airline has also modestly increased its traffic guidance for fiscal-year 2023 to 168 million from 166.5 million, 
equating to a 13% increase on pre-Covid-19 traffic.
The agency expects Ryanair to deleverage to within funds from operations (FFO) adjusted net leverage of below 
1.5x in 2023, one year ahead of Fitch's previous forecast.
"Strong deleveraging capacity results from strong traffic recovery and solid financial performance in 1HFY23 that 
we expect to continue in 3QFY23, albeit hampered by a tougher macroeconomic outlook," Fitch stated.
Earlier this month Ryanair confirmed plans to aim for broadly zero net debt by the beginning of fiscal-year 2024.
Fitch noted that Ryanair has also taken advantage of many carriers' bankruptcy and legacy carriers' capacity 
reduction to deploy its new fleet of 71 Boeing 737 Max aircraft.
Ryanair expects its fleet to grow to about 620 aircraft at the end of fiscal-year 2026 from 466 units as of the end of 
2020.
Ryanair held total liquidity of (EURO)4.6 billion ($4.8 billion) as of 30 September, which will be used to repay 
(EURO)1.6 billion of bonds maturing between March and August 2023 as well as to fund aircraft deliveries over the 
coming years. The carrier estimates around (EURO)2.3 billion capital expenditure for fiscal year 2023 and up to 
(EURO)2.2 billion for 2024.
"Some of that could move if Boeing are delayed but the next two years are our peak Capex years," Ryanair 
Holdings chief executive officer Michael O'Leary said earlier this month.
Ryanair outlook turns positive
Fitch's outlook adjustment is also based on Ryanair's unencumbered asset base, with over 90% of its 737 fleet 
unencumbered as of 30 September, which Fitch says "increases its financial flexibility and funding options, 
especially considering its current environment of high interest rates."
The agency noted that Ryanair is one of its highest-rated airlines, together with Southwest Airlines, both of which 
profit from their low-cost business model with comparable pre-pandemic net leverage and operating margins.
"Wizz Air is considerably smaller than Ryanair, but also benefits from a low-cost position and solid liquidity. It has a 
strong market position in the growing central and eastern European market," Fitch continued.
Load-Date: December 5, 2022
End of Document

Rating[2]) by 27.5% during the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The fund 
owned 28,566 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 6,157 shares during the 
period. Ryanair makes up about 0.3% of George Kaiser Family Foundation's investment portfolio, making the stock 
its 29th largest position. George Kaiser Family Foundation's holdings in Ryanair were worth $1,921,000 at the end 
of the most recent quarter.

Cover Genius Lands $70M to Keep Expanding Its Successful Embedded Business Model
Cover Genius Lands $70M to Keep Expanding Its Successful Embedded 
Business Model
Newstex Blogs 
Grit Daily
November 1, 2022 Tuesday 8:00 PM EST
Copyright 2022 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 1239 words
Byline: Spencer Hulse
Body
Nov 01, 2022( Grit Daily: https://gritdaily.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Cover Genius Series D funding round key points: 
The Series D funding round saw Cover Genius bring in $70 million led by Dawn Capital.The round represents a 
significant valuation uplift for the company, which had a huge year of growth since the Series C round in 
2021.Cover Genius offers a tech-forward insurance solution that runs on an embedded business model. It is 
precisely that model the company plans to expand with the latest funding. 
Insurtech[1] is a major market, and competition is stiff. That makes it all the more impressive that Cover Genius has 
reached a new high of $1.1 million in gross premiums in a single day and around 10.5 million customers. Moreover, 
it only plans to find more as it expands its embedded business model. Learn more about this fast-growing company 
and what it plans to do with its Series D funding in the following press release. 
Cover Genius[2], the global insurtech for embedded insurance, today announced it has raised $70M USD in Series 
D funding in a round led by Dawn Capital, with participation from new investor, New York-based Atlas Merchant 
Capital, and existing investors including GSquared and King River Capital. The raise will assist in the insurtech's 
rapid business growth and expansion of its award-winning global insurance distribution platform,XCover[3]. 
The oversubscribed round represents a significant valuation uplift from Cover Genius' Series C in 2021. Since then, 
the company has experienced a year of immense growth, reaching $1.1m in daily Gross Written Premium(GWP), 
nearly tripling its year-over-year revenue, and doubling its partnership base with new logos including leading 
American travel app, Hopper, two of the world's largest airlines, Ryanair and Turkish Airlines, buy-now, pay later 
leader, Zip; and Indian gig economy platforms, Ola and Betterplace. 
The insurtech has also deepened its global capabilities by investing in India-based insurtech, ensuredIT, and 
broadened its reach in key verticalsby acquiring a leading specialist in ticket refund protection, Booking Protect[4]- 
which brings market leaders like SeatGeek, Seetickets, Tessitura, Secutix, Audienceview, Zaiko and more onto the 
XCover platform. 
'We've always been strategic about our approach to fundraising, and closing our highest-ever funding round in a 
challenging environment for raising capital reinforces the strength of our embedded business model,' said Angus 
McDonald, CEO and co-founder of Cover Genius. 'Customers are dissatisfied with traditional insurers who went 
missing during the pandemic and consistently deliver low post-claim Net Promoter Scores (NPS) scores. Our tech-
Cover Genius Lands $70M to Keep Expanding Its Successful Embedded Business Model
forward solution focuses on a seamless and transparent customer journey and, in contrast to traditional insurers, 
delivers a post-claim NPS of +65‡.' 
Cover Genius offers embedded protection to multiple industries includingairlines[5],travel and rental 
companies[6],retail[7],financial 
services[8],real 
estate[9],logistics[10], 
ticketing,gig 
economy 
and 
benefit 
companies[11]and more. Its roster of partners includes the world's largest digital companies, includingBooking 
Holdings, owner of Priceline, Kayak and Booking.com, Intuit,Hopper[6],Skyscanner[12],Ryanair[5],Zip[8]and 
SeatGeek.XCover[3], 
Cover 
Genius' 
award-winning 
global 
distribution 
platform, 
is 
also 
available 
atAmazon[13],eBay[14], Wayfair,Flipkart[15], and SE Asia's largest company,Shopee[16]. 
The platform is licensed or authorized in more than 60 countries and all 50 US states and delivers personalized 
insurance and warranty products in any country, language and currency alongside available instant claim payments 
around the world. 
'Cover Genius is rethinking insurance distribution with a tech-forward platform that enables partners and end-
customers to provide and access protection at the point of need, ' said Dan Chaplin, Principal at Dawn Capital. 
'Embedded insurance is a rapidly growing segment of the market, and Cover Genius has built a leading platform 
that is globally enabled, multi-line and end-to-end. They're working with some of the world's largest platforms in 
multiple industries, and have combined exponential growth this year with an exceptionally strong business model. 
We're excited to support Cover Genius as it continues to reshape the insurance industry and enable easy protection 
for consumers and businesses.' 
About Cover Genius 
Cover Genius[17]is the insurtech for embedded insurance that protects the global customers of the world's largest 
digital 
companies 
including 
Booking 
Holdings, 
owner 
of 
Priceline, 
Kayak 
and 
Booking.com, 
Intuit,Hopper[6],Skyscanner[12],Ryanair[5],Descartes ShipRush[18],Zip[8]and SeatGeek. We're alsoavailable at 
Amazon[13],Flipkart[15],eBay[14], Wayfair and SE Asia's largest company,Shopee[16]. Cover Genius' vision is to 
protect all the customers of the world's largest online companies throughXCover[3], an award-winning global 
distribution platform for any line of insurance or warranty, with an API for instant claims payments that holds an 
industry-leading NPS of +65‡. 
Cover Genius and partners co-create solutions that embed protection that's licensed or authorized in over 60 
countries & all 50 US States. 
About Dawn Capital 
Dawn is Europe's largest specialist B2B software investor partnering with founders building the 
next generation of global software leaders. Dawn supports them to harness extraordinary teams, exceptional 
technology and scalable business models on their way to building category-defining global companies. Dawn 
invests from early stage right through the scale-up journey in growth rounds through to exit. Its roster of investments 
includes Mimecast (formerly NASDAQ-listed, taken private by Permira in a $5.8bn transaction), iZettle (sold to 
PayPal for $2.2bn cash), Tink (acquired by Visa for $2.0bn), as well as current leaders, Collibra, Dataiku, Quantexa, 
Soldo, Copper and Firebolt, amongst others. 
The original press release[19] can be found on the Cover Genius website.

New deliveries through October 2022
New deliveries through October 2022
Newstex Blogs 
AirInsight
November 1, 2022 Tuesday 2:06 PM EST
Copyright 2022 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 322 words
Byline: Addison Schonland
Body
Nov 01, 2022( AirInsight: http://airinsight.com Delivered by Newstex)  
 A new month and an opportunity to look back. What do we see for new delivery estimates through October 2022? 
Here are some notes from our delivery tracker. Official OEM numbers will be published around the 10th of 
November.  
The duopoly remains out of balance. This is a concern for the entire commercial aviation sector.  
Airbus is out delivering Boeing by 1.3 to 1 and Airbus has hardly any freighter business YTD Airbus has a 53.3% 
delivery market share to Boeing's 39.3% 
This is despite the top delivery customers for Boeing being Southwest, Ryanair, Alaska, and United, respectively 
The most delivered new aircraft are MAX8 (216), A321neo (193), A320neo (159), and MAX9 (45) - 33 new MAX8-
200s have been delivered through YTD October  
The disparity between Airbus and Boeing is writ large - Boeing needs the MAX10 ASAP The threat of cancellation 
is a double-edged sword for Boeing - Boeing needs the MAX10 and cancellation weakens the MAX family where it 
needs the most support 
In terms of twin aisles, Airbus delivered 40 A350-900s, 8 A350-1000s, 16 A330-900s, and 2 A330-800s. Boeing 
delivered 19 777Fs, 13 767Fs, 11 787-8s, 4 747Fs 3 777s, 2 787-10s and one 787-9 
Airbus is coming to the freight business late. The freighter (and military) business has been a savior for Boeing. 
Embraer remains primarily a regional-focused OEM. It delivered three times as many E-175s and E2s.  
 https://airinsight.com/author/addison-schonland/  
 Co-Founder AirInsight. My previous life includes stints at Shell South Africa, CIC Research, and PA Consulting. 
Got bitten by the aviation bug and ended up an Avgeek. Then the data bug got me, making me a curious Avgeek 
seeking data-driven logic. Also, I appreciate conversations with smart people from whom I learn so much. 
Summary: I am very fortunate to work with and converse with great people. 
Link to the original story.

Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC Boosts Stock Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( 
NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC Boosts Stock 
Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY)
Newstex Blogs 
Watchlist News
October 31, 2022 Monday 1:30 PM EST
Copyright 2022 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 827 words
Body
Oct 31, 2022( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC raised its holdings in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) by 2.6% during the second quarter, according to its most recent filing with the 
SEC. The firm owned 12,953 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 330 
shares during the period. Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC's holdings in Ryanair were 
worth $871,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
A number of other institutional investors have also added to or reduced their stakes in the business. Capital 
International Investors grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 18.0% in the 1st quarter. Capital International 
Investors now owns 11,270,188 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $981,539,000 after buying an 
additional 1,722,195 shares during the last quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA grew its position in 
shares of Ryanair by 6.3% in the 1st quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 8,998,270 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $783,929,000 after buying an additional 532,961 shares during 
the last quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 11.8% in the 1st quarter. 
Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 5,787,913 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$504,242,000 after buying an additional 612,114 shares during the last quarter. William Blair Investment 
Management LLC grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 13.1% in the 1st quarter. William Blair Investment 
Management LLC now owns 2,923,790 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $254,669,000 after 
buying an additional 338,051 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Wellington Management Group LLP grew its 
position in shares of Ryanair by 13.5% in the 1st quarter. Wellington Management Group LLP now owns 2,071,104 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $180,436,000 after buying an additional 246,276 shares during 
the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 43.70% of the company's stock.  
Wall Street Analyst Weigh In 
RYAAY has been the subject of several research reports. UBS Group lifted their price objective on shares of 
Ryanair from €19.20 ($19.59) to €21.00 ($21.43) in a research note on Wednesday, August 10th. Raymond James 
cut their target price on shares of Ryanair from $112.00 to $102.00 and set a 'strong-buy' rating for the company in 
a report on Wednesday, October 5th. Stifel Nicolaus lowered shares of Ryanair from a 'hold' rating to a 'sell' rating 
in a report on Wednesday, September 14th. StockNews.com[2] lowered shares of Ryanair from a 'buy' rating to a 
Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC Boosts Stock Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( 
NASDAQ :RYAAY)
'hold' rating in a report on Friday. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut their target price on shares of Ryanair from 
€19.20 ($19.59) to €17.70 ($18.06) in a report on Monday, October 10th. One investment analyst has rated the 
stock with a sell rating, four have assigned a hold rating, six have assigned a buy rating and one has given a strong 
buy rating to the company's stock. According to data from MarketBeat, Ryanair has an average rating of 'Moderate 
Buy' and an average price target of $47.87. 
Ryanair Stock Performance 
 NASDAQ RYAAY[3] opened at $67.86 on Monday. The firm's 50-day moving average is $66.15 and its two-
hundred day moving average is $74.25. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12 month low of $55.90 and a 12 month high of 
$127.25. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.59, a current ratio of 1.08 and a quick ratio of 1.08. The stock 
has a market capitalization of $15.43 billion, a P/E ratio of 62.83 and a beta of 1.44. Ryanair Company Profile 
 (Get Rating[2]) 
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, duty-
free, and merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its 
website and mobile app.

October 31, 2022 Monday 8:35 AM EST

Body
Oct 31, 2022( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgStockNews.com[1] lowered shares of Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[2] - Get Rating[1]) from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research note released on Friday 
morning. 
A number of other analysts have also recently commented on the company. Raymond James dropped their price 
target on Ryanair from $112.00 to $102.00 and set a strong-buy rating on the stock in a research report on 
Wednesday, October 5th. Stifel Nicolaus cut Ryanair from a hold rating to a sell rating in a research report on 
Wednesday, September 14th. Liberum Capital cut Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research report on 
Wednesday, October 12th. JPMorgan Chase & Co. lowered their price objective on Ryanair from €19.20 ($19.59) to 
€17.70 ($18.06) in a research report on Monday, October 10th. Finally, UBS Group upped their price objective on 
Ryanair from €19.20 ($19.59) to €21.00 ($21.43) in a research report on Wednesday, August 10th. One equities 
research analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, four have given a hold rating, six have issued a buy rating 
and one has given a strong buy rating to the stock. According to data from MarketBeat.com, the stock presently has 
a consensus rating of Moderate Buy and a consensus price target of $47.87. 
Ryanair Stock Performance 
Shares of RYAAY[3] opened at $67.86 on Friday. The company has a quick ratio of 1.08, a current ratio of 1.08 and 
a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.59. The business's 50 day moving average price is $66.15 and its 200-day moving 
average price is $74.25. Ryanair has a 52 week low of $55.90 and a 52 week high of $127.25. The stock has a 
market cap of $15.43 billion, a P/E ratio of 62.83 and a beta of 1.44.  
Institutional Investors Weigh In On Ryanair 
 Several hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently modified their holdings of the stock. Capital 
International Investors increased its stake in shares of Ryanair by 18.0% in the 1st quarter. Capital International 
Investors now owns 11,270,188 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $981,539,000 after purchasing 
an additional 1,722,195 shares in the last quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA increased its stake in

owns 9,685,552 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $651,353,000 after buying an additional 
417,273 shares in the last quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC increased its stake in Ryanair by 4.4% in the 
2nd quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 6,042,557 shares of the transportation company's stock

Ryanair Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC raised its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) by 2.6% in the 2nd quarter, Holdings Channel  reports. The institutional investor  
owned 12,953 shares of the transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 330 shares during the 
period. Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC's holdings in Ryanair were worth $871,000 at 
the end of the most recent quarter.  
Other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. 
Harding Loevner LP acquired a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the 1st quarter valued at about $48,000.  
Parallel Advisors LLC acquired a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the 2nd quarter valued at about $64,000.  
Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. lifted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 55.7% in the 1st quarter. Migdal 
Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. now owns 1,183 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$100,000 after purchasing an additional 423 shares in the last quarter.  Compagnie Lombard Odier SCmA acquired 
a new position in  Ryanair during the 1st quarter worth approximately $122,000.  Finally, Harbor Investment 
Advisory LLC lifted its position in  Ryanair by 8.4% during the 2nd quarter. Harbor Investment Advisory LLC now 
owns 2,471 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $166,000 after acquiring an additional 192 shares 
in the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own  43.70% of the company's stock.  Ryanair 
Stock Performance

ratio of 1.08 and a current ratio of 1.08. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1 year low of $55.90 and a 1 year high of 
$127.25. The stock has a fifty day moving average of $66.15 and a two-hundred day moving average of $74.25. 
The firm has a market capitalization of $15.43 billion, a PE ratio of 62.83 and a beta of 1.44.  Wall Street Analyst 
Weigh In

on Ryanair from  19.20 ($19.59) to  17.70 ($18.06) in a research report on Monday, October 10th. Stifel Nicolaus 
downgraded Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Wednesday, September 14th.

United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, duty-
free, and merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its 
website and mobile app.Featured Stories

Ryanair ( NASDAQ : RYAAY ) Downgraded by StockNews.com
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Downgraded by StockNews.com
American Banking and Market News
October 31, 2022 Monday
Copyright 2022 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 570 words
Body
StockNews.com  downgraded shares of Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY  - Get Rating ) from a buy rating to a hold 
rating in a report published on Friday. 
A number of other equities research analysts have also commented on the company. JPMorgan Chase & Co. 
reduced their price target on Ryanair from  19.20 ($19.59) to  17.70 ($18.06) in a research report on Monday, 
October 10th. Stifel Nicolaus lowered Ryanair from a hold rating to a sell rating in a research report on Wednesday, 
September 14th. Liberum Capital lowered Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research report on 
Wednesday, October 12th. UBS Group upped their price target on Ryanair from  19.20 ($19.59) to  21.00 ($21.43) 
in a research report on Wednesday, August 10th. Finally, Raymond James cut their target price on Ryanair from 
$112.00 to $102.00 and set a strong-buy rating on the stock in a research report on Wednesday, October 5th. One 
analyst  has rated the stock with a sell rating, four have given a hold rating, six have issued  a buy rating and one  
has assigned  a strong buy rating to the stock. According to data from MarketBeat.com, the stock presently has a 
consensus rating of Moderate Buy and a consensus price target of $47.87. Ryanair Price Performance
Ryanair stock  opened at $67.86 on Friday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.59, a quick ratio of 1.08 
and a current ratio of 1.08. Ryanair has a 52 week low of $55.90 and a 52 week high of $127.25. The stock has a 
market capitalization of $15.43 billion, a P/E ratio of 62.83 and a beta of 1.44. The stock has a fifty day moving 
average of $66.15 and a 200-day moving average of $74.25.  Institutional Trading of Ryanair
Large investors have recently bought and sold shares of the company. Harding Loevner LP purchased a new stake 
in  Ryanair in the first quarter worth $48,000.  Parallel Advisors LLC bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair in 
the second quarter worth $64,000.  Ronald Blue Trust Inc. bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the 
second quarter worth $90,000.  Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. boosted its holdings in shares of  
Ryanair by 55.7% in the first quarter. Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. now owns 1,183 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $100,000 after acquiring an additional 423 shares during the period.  Finally, 
Compagnie Lombard Odier SCmA bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the first quarter worth $122,000. 
43.70% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors.  About Ryanair (Get Rating )
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, duty-
free, and merchandise; and marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its 
website and mobile app.See Also

 Royal Mail plc (OTCMKTS:ROYMF[1] - Get Rating[2]) was the recipient of a large increase in short interest in the 
month of October. 
As of October 15th, there was short interest totalling 110,300 shares, an increase of 32.3% from the September 
30th total of 83,400 shares. Based on an average trading volume of 600 shares, the days-to-cover ratio is presently 
183.8 days. Wall Street Analysts Forecast Growth Separately, JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut Royal Mail from an 
"overweight" rating to a "neutral" rating in a report on Friday, September 16th. Royal Mail Stock Performance 
OTCMKTS ROYMF[3] remained flat at $2.18 on Friday. The business's fifty day moving average price is $2.71 and 
its 200 day moving average price is $3.39. Royal Mail has a one year low of $2.18 and a one year high of $7.05. 
Royal Mail Company Profile (Get Rating[2]) International Distributions Services Plc engages in the provision of 
postal and delivery services. It operates through the following segments: Royal Mail and General Logistics Systems 
(GLS). The Royal Mail segment collects, sorts and delivers letters and parcels across the UK. The GLS segment 
operates in continental Europe and the Republic of Ireland and has a ground-based deferred parcel delivery

 Nexien BioPharma, Inc. (OTCMKTS:NXEN[1] - Get Rating[2]) was the target of a large decrease in short interest in 
October. 
As of October 15th, there was short interest totalling 5,300 shares, a decrease of 15.9% from the September 30th 
total of 6,300 shares. Based on an average daily trading volume, of 27,000 shares, the short-interest ratio is 
presently 0.2 days. Nexien BioPharma Trading Down 25.0 % NXEN stock[3] traded down $0.02 during midday 
trading on Friday, reaching $0.05. 11,000 shares of the company's stock traded hands, compared to its average 
volume of 11,448. The company has a 50-day simple moving average of $0.06 and a two-hundred day simple 
moving average of $0.07. Nexien BioPharma has a 1-year low of $0.03 and a 1-year high of $0.20. Nexien 
BioPharma Company Profile (Get Rating[2]) Nexien BioPharma, Inc operates as a pharmaceutical company. It 
focuses on the formulation, development, and commercialization of cannabinoid-based pharmaceuticals, drug 
delivery systems, and related technologies for diseases, disorders, and medical conditions. The company was 
formerly known as Intiva BioPharma Inc and changed its name to Nexien BioPharma, Inc in September 2018.

 Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC raised its holdings in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[1] - Get Rating[2]) by 2.6% during the second quarter, according to its most recent filing with the 
SEC. The firm owned 12,953 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 330 
shares during the period. Northwestern Mutual Investment Management Company LLC's holdings in Ryanair were 
worth $871,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
A number of other institutional investors have also added to or reduced their stakes in the business. Capital 
International Investors grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 18.0% in the 1st quarter. Capital International 
Investors now owns 11,270,188 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $981,539,000 after buying an 
additional 1,722,195 shares during the last quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA grew its position in 
shares of Ryanair by 6.3% in the 1st quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 8,998,270 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $783,929,000 after buying an additional 532,961 shares during 
the last quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 11.8% in the 1st quarter.

$504,242,000 after buying an additional 612,114 shares during the last quarter. William Blair Investment 
Management LLC grew its position in shares of Ryanair by 13.1% in the 1st quarter. William Blair Investment 
Management LLC now owns 2,923,790 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $254,669,000 after 
buying an additional 338,051 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Wellington Management Group LLP grew its 
position in shares of Ryanair by 13.5% in the 1st quarter. Wellington Management Group LLP now owns 2,071,104 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $180,436,000 after buying an additional 246,276 shares during 
the last quarter. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 43.70% of the company's stock. Wall Street

 Lynas Rare Earths Limited (OTCMKTS:LYSCF[1] - Get Rating[2]) saw a large decline in short interest in October. 
As of October 15th, there was short interest totalling 461,300 shares, a decline of 16.3% from the September 30th 
total of 551,100 shares. Based on an average daily volume of 116,400 shares, the days-to-cover ratio is presently 
4.0 days. Lynas Rare Earths Price Performance LYSCF[3] traded down $0.15 during trading on Friday, reaching 
$5.25. The company's stock had a trading volume of 50,040 shares, compared to its average volume of 89,009. 
Lynas Rare Earths has a 52-week low of $4.60 and a 52-week high of $8.63. The company's fifty day moving 
average price is $5.35 and its 200-day moving average price is $5.99. Lynas Rare Earths Company Profile (Get 
Rating[2]) Lynas Rare Earths Limited, together with its subsidiaries, engages in the exploration, development, 
mining, extraction, and processing of rare earth minerals primarily in Australia and Malaysia. The company holds an 
interest in the Mount Weld project, Western Australia. Its products include yttrium, lanthanum, cerium, 
praseodymium, neodymium, promethium, samarium, europium, gadolinium, terbium, dysprosium, holmium, erbium, 
thulium, ytterbium, and lutetium. Read MoreGet a free copy of the StockNews.com research report on Lynas Rare

Ryanair To Relocate If Ireland 's Socialist Party Government Assumes Power, CEO Says
Ryanair To Relocate If Ireland's Socialist Party Government Assumes Power, 
CEO Says
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
October 31, 2022 Monday 00:18
Copyright 2022 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 71 words
Body
 Ryanair (RYA.IR) Chief Executive Michael O'Leary warned that the company will exit Ireland if the country's 
socialist political party Sinn Féin gains power and changes the corporate tax regime, The Telegraph reported Oct. 
29. 
"If corporation tax rates start getting messed around with by a Sinn Féin government then yes, we would move," 
O'Leary commented. 
Shares of the Irish budget carrier were down over 1% on Oct. 28 close. 
Load-Date: November 2, 2022
End of Document

Oct 31, 2022( Ticker Report: http://www.tickerreport.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  
 https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgStockNews.com[1] downgraded shares of Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[2] - Get Rating[1]) from a buy rating to a hold rating in a report published on Friday. 
A number of other equities research analysts have also commented on the company. JPMorgan Chase & Co. 
reduced their price target on Ryanair from €19.20 ($19.59) to €17.70 ($18.06) in a research report on Monday, 
October 10th. Stifel Nicolaus lowered Ryanair from a hold rating to a sell rating in a research report on Wednesday, 
September 14th. Liberum Capital lowered Ryanair from a buy rating to a hold rating in a research report on 
Wednesday, October 12th. UBS Group upped their price target on Ryanair from €19.20 ($19.59) to €21.00 ($21.43) 
in a research report on Wednesday, August 10th. Finally, Raymond James cut their target price on Ryanair from 
$112.00 to $102.00 and set a strong-buy rating on the stock in a research report on Wednesday, October 5th. One 
analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, four have given a hold rating, six have issued a buy rating and one has 
assigned a strong buy rating to the stock. According to data from MarketBeat.com, the stock presently has a 
consensus rating of Moderate Buy and a consensus price target of $47.87. Ryanair Price Performance Ryanair 
stock[3] opened at $67.86 on Friday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.59, a quick ratio of 1.08 and a 
current ratio of 1.08. Ryanair has a 52 week low of $55.90 and a 52 week high of $127.25. The stock has a market 
capitalization of $15.43 billion, a P/E ratio of 62.83 and a beta of 1.44. The stock has a fifty day moving average of 
$66.15 and a 200-day moving average of $74.25. Institutional Trading of Ryanair Large investors have recently 
bought and sold shares of the company. Harding Loevner LP purchased a new stake in Ryanair in the first quarter 
worth $48,000. Parallel Advisors LLC bought a new position in shares of Ryanair in the second quarter worth 
$64,000. Ronald Blue Trust Inc. bought a new position in shares of Ryanair in the second quarter worth $90,000. 
Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 55.7% in the first quarter. 
Migdal Insurance & Financial Holdings Ltd. now owns 1,183 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$100,000 after acquiring an additional 423 shares during the period. Finally, Compagnie Lombard Odier SCmA 
bought a new position in shares of Ryanair in the first quarter worth $122,000. 43.70% of the stock is owned by 
hedge funds and other institutional investors. About Ryanair (Get Rating[1]) Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its 
subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, Germany, 
and other European countries. It is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight 
scheduled and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, duty-free, and merchandise; and 
marketing of car hire and accommodation services, and travel insurance through its website and mobile app. See

stock is owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.  About Pulmatrix (Get Rating )

treat respiratory and other diseases with unmet medical needs in the United States. The company focuses on 
developing products based on its inhaled small particles easily respirable and emitted (iSPERSE) technology, which 
enables delivery of small or large molecule drugs to the lungs by inhalation for local or systemic 
applications.Featured Stories

stock in a transaction dated Thursday, October 27th. The shares were sold at an average price of GBX 165 ($1.99),

Shares of LON SDI  opened at GBX 160 ($1.93) on Friday. SDI Group plc has a 12-month low of GBX 129 ($1.56) 
and a 12-month high of GBX 218 ($2.63). The stock has a market cap of £163.52 million and a PE ratio of 2,285.71. 
The company has a current ratio of 1.10, a quick ratio of 0.65 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 31.95. The company has 
a 50-day moving average of GBX 165.46 and a 200 day moving average of GBX 161.82.  SDI Group Company 
Profile (Get Rating )
SDI Group plc, through its subsidiaries, designs and manufactures scientific and technology products based on 
digital imaging in the United Kingdom, rest of Europe, the United States, Asia, and internationally. It operates in two 
segments, Digital Imaging and Sensors & Control segments. The company offers sensitive camera for life science 
and industrial applications under the Atik Camera brand name; cameras for art conservation under the Opus 
Instruments brand name; and camera that have applications in astronomy and life science fields under the 
Quantum Scientific Imaging brand name.See Also

CleanTech Acquisition ( NASDAQ :CLAQ) Trading Up 3.1%
CleanTech Acquisition (NASDAQ:CLAQ) Trading Up 3.1%
American Banking and Market News
October 30, 2022 Sunday
Copyright 2022 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 362 words
Body
CleanTech Acquisition CleanTech Acquisition Corp. (NASDAQ:CLAQ  - Get Rating )'s share price was up 3.1% 
during trading on Friday . The company traded as high as $3.31 and last traded at $3.30. Approximately 21,701 
shares were traded  during trading, a decline of 60% from the average daily volume of 54,312 shares. The stock 
had previously closed at $3.20. CleanTech Acquisition Stock Performance
The stock's 50-day simple moving average is $6.22 and its 200 day simple moving average is $8.75.  Hedge Funds 
Weigh In On CleanTech Acquisition
A number of large investors have recently bought and sold shares of CLAQ. Fir Tree Capital Management LP 
purchased a new position in  CleanTech Acquisition during the 1st quarter worth $118,000.  Glazer Capital LLC 
raised its position in  CleanTech Acquisition by 2,010.8% during the 1st quarter. Glazer Capital LLC now owns 
422,162 shares of the company's stock worth $4,234,000 after buying an additional 402,162 shares during the last 
quarter.  Spartan Fund Management Inc. purchased a new position in  CleanTech Acquisition during the 1st quarter 
worth $1,315,000.  Bank of America Corp DE purchased a new position in  CleanTech Acquisition during the 1st 
quarter worth $5,015,000.  Finally, OTA Financial Group L.P. purchased a new position in  CleanTech Acquisition 
during the 2nd quarter worth $295,000. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own  71.67% of the company's 
stock.  About CleanTech Acquisition (Get Rating )
CleanTech Acquisition Corp. does not have significant operations. It intends to effect a merger, capital stock 
exchange, asset acquisition, stock purchase, reorganization, or similar business combination with one or more 
businesses. The company was incorporated in 2020 and is based in New York, New York.Featured Articles

Golden Agri-Resources (OTCMKTS:GARPY) Stock Price Up 0.3%
Golden Agri-Resources (OTCMKTS:GARPY) Stock Price Up 0.3%
American Banking and Market News
October 30, 2022 Sunday
Copyright 2022 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 259 words
Body
Golden Agri-Resources Shares of Golden Agri-Resources Ltd (OTCMKTS:GARPY  - Get Rating ) rose 0.3% during 
mid-day trading on Friday . The company traded as high as $19.50 and last traded at $19.50. Approximately 129 
shares changed hands during trading, a decline of 88% from the average daily volume of 1,081 shares. The stock 
had previously closed at $19.44. Golden Agri-Resources Stock Performance
The stock has a fifty day simple moving average of $19.08 and a 200-day simple moving average of $19.97.  About 
Golden Agri-Resources (Get Rating )
Golden Agri-Resources Ltd, an investment holding company, operates as an integrated palm oil plantation 
company in Europe, China, India, Pakistan, the Middle east, and the United States. It operates in two segments, 
Plantation and Palm Oil Mills; and Palm, Laurics and Others. The company offers bulk products, such as crude 
palm oil, palm kernel, palm kernel oil, palm kernel meal, olein, stearin, soybean oil, and soybean meal; oleo 
chemicals; palm oil based bio-diesel and other renewable resources based energy; and refined products, including 
cooking oil, margarine, shortening, butter oil substitute, and fats.Featured Articles
•
